My husband found this place on line. So glad we tried it! This will for sure be a place that we will return to every time we make it to Vegas. I got the prime rib. It was great. My husband ordered the surf and turf. That steak and lobster was AMAZING! They are also known for their table side Cesar Salad so don't pass that up. Even if just one person in your party orders it, 2 people can share.. it is pretty big. The decor is old school but in a CLEAN updated way.

This was our first time - we loved it!
The food was delicious. The service and overall attention was perfect.
Don't pay too much attention to the seedy parking lot...

First of all, If you're looking for a glitzy steakhouse with a Food Channel Chef's name on it; this is not the place for you.

This is an old school Las Vegas steakhouse!!!

I am a local and have been to the Golden Steer on multiple occasions and never go home disappointed.

The staff is always friendly and the steaks are always a good quality cut.

The best part of this place, besides the meat, is the history.  For the out of towner's, this is the place where the Rat Pack used to eat and hang out after playing a show at the Sahara, what is now the SLS.  This is also where the Goodfella's used to hang out and eat.  If you ask the staff, they will be more than happy to recall countless stories about either.

Anytime someone is in town visiting, I take them here.  There are a million cookie cutter steakhouses on Las Vegas Blvd., but there's only one Golden Steer.


**There is one more thing I would like to add.  If there is something you do not like during your visit to the Golden Steer, try to bring it up to the management.  The staff at the Golden Steer take a lot of pride in what they do, but it's very difficult to change or correct an issue if they do not know something is wrong.  This restaurant has been in business for decades, and hopefully it will continue to serve Vegas for decades more.**

Went there on Friday Jan 28 for my parents' anniversary - party of 7.

The service was great. They kept our party fed and watered in a timely manner. Quality of the cocktails was excellent. The waiter engaged in friendly conversation.

The food was great. Our party of 7 covered quite a bit of ground for appetizers, soups, salads, entrées, sides and desserts. The steaks were very good - though not above what I've had at other places. All 7 of us enjoyed the experience. It was a nice "old Vegas" atmosphere.  

We ended with a couple orders of bananas Foster which we passed around. Highly recommended for the table-side preparation and the quality of the dessert (it was really good).

The first time that we went there it was awesome, since then we have been there three of four more times and it was more disappointing each time (and no we are not bad tippers).  The food is great and I really like the menu but the service is so terrible it ruins the entire experience.  They have a team service approach where any of the waiters can wait on you, but instead of the service being excellent they are just trying to push you out the door and you do not receive attentive service at all.  When I am paying $200 for dinner I expect the food to be excellent and the service to be professional.  The last time that we went there after we had been seated for about 15 minutes and a busser had brought us water a waiter came up to our table smacking gum, leaned on the table, clicked his pen and said "are you ready to order?"  WHAT!!!!!  This is something that I would expect at a Denny's not at a high end steak house.  I was actually mad that the waiter was so abrupt and I thought the gum chewing was DISGUSTING.  

We explained that we were not ready to order quite yet and he just turned and walked away.  A couple minutes later another waiter comes up and says "are you ready to order?  There was no introduction, didn't ask us if we had been there before and did not discuss the menu at all.  We finally ordered and another waiter brought our food out.  There was an issue with how the steak was cooked but we had to sit there waiting trying to catch a waiter's attention.  After sitting there for about 10 minutes not eating a waiter finally came over and asked if everything was OK (a different waiter).  We explained that there was an issue and he took the steak back.  

I am actually sorry that the service is so bad because I like the restaurant, but when waiters are unprofessional and discourteous it ruins the experience for me.  The prices are commensurate with high-end steak houses on the strip but the service is not.

The Golden Steer was fantastic! From the table side Caesar salad and bananas foster to my perfectly cooked filet and yummy twice baked potato. All the servers were nice and attentive. We were in the side room (party of 6) and I would love to sit in the main room next time (in one of the little booths). The atmosphere was cool and although it's a pretty classy joint, it had a casual feel to it. I highly recommend it!

This place encompasses all the things that a great steak house should be.  The ambience is that of Old Style Las Vegas.  We were seated in Muhammad Ali's booth (a party of 6) which was way cool!  I had a salad to start.  It was okay, just your basic dinner salad.  My husband and I both ordered steak.  I got a petite filet and my husband ordered a filet.  Both were cooked to perfection.  Leave it to a steak house to get it right.  I also had the twice baked potato which was delicious as well. My husband had the asparagus and they were cooked enough but still had a little crunch to them and were very good.  To end the night, I had been hearing good things about the bananas foster that they make table side.  People come here for the bananas foster and cherries jubilee.  Because this is an older Las Vegas establishment, they are grandfathered in and one of the only places that are allowed to have an open flame to make their signature desserts.  I must say that my first bananas foster experience did NOT disappoint.  The one caveat is that they could not split up our check, however they do take multiple forms of payment. Note: Proper attire (business casual) is expected at all times.

Everytime I come back here I love it even more. The service is always top notch and the atmosphere is classic. The steaks are always tender and delicious. Would recommend to anyone coming in out of town. Definitely a once in a while treat.

I went to this place with some high expectation since a guy said it was the best SH in Vegas. I was very disappointed!
If large portions mean good to you this place is for you.

My filet Mignon was crap.. I ordered it MR and it came out burnt on the entire outside which left about 3/4 inch of extremely well done dry hard steak and then a absolutely raw center. not to mention a quite large piece of grizzle i spit out and hide under my parsley garnish.

my buddy got the onion ring which were very good. Chop salad was very good with blue cheese dressing.

Overall probably the worst steak house I have been to in Vegas.

Avoid this place. way to many great steak houses.

Went here to try something slightly different than our favorite- Hugo's Cellar. Wish we wouldn't have:( Half the servers were a pleasure, the other half seemed very unhappy. Although the quality of the food was high, the taste left much to be desired. Service seemed very unorganized which is strange for such an established restaurant. The hostess seemed confused, multiple servers asked if anyone "had gotten your drinks" and "did anyone ask you if you'd like dessert". One server took the check with card in it even though "it was not his table". The facilities were dirty for the sake of not going into detail. Overall- for the money and drive- Hugo's got this place beat 10x over on quality, price, taste, cleanliness and service!

Wow!   A step back in time!   If you liked old Las Vegas then have dinner here.  We celebrated my daughters Birthday with friends and loved it.  The service was exceptional, the food was prepared and presented beautifully and the drinks were made properly.   We had Escargot, perfectly prepared. Jumbo and I mean jumbo shrimp cocktail and seafood stuffed mushrooms to start.  All perfectly prepared.  Caesar's salad was crisp and well presented. All the steaks were cooked to perfection and extremely tender with aged flavor.  The side dished were tasty and all the food was at the proper temperature.  Almost ate too much bread it was so good.  This was our 3th time here and will return. Always consistent with service and food. As you drive up its a little questionable with parking but don't lit that scare you away. Step back in time and enjoy this place!

I just received the worst service experience in my years of eating at high end steak houses. The food was good overall but I don't need to be disrespected and insulted on top of mediocre service when I'm dropping a grand in your establishment.

We had a group of 8 get together for a post Viva Las Vegas dinner. Please note that while this is a rockabilly convention we all dressed up to the nines for a "classy" dinner experience at the Golden Steer. When we arrived we asked to have separate checks because as with many high end steakhouses, the items are served ala carte. Thus, it makes figuring the bill at the end a nightmare with this many people. The excuse was the computer system can't handle it..and apparently writing it down on paper is too hard as well for the 200 dollar tip. Our group was not loud nor over demanding yet had a lot of trouble getting service in general as others have mentioned in reviews recently. 

As expected, the chaos begins when it comes check time. We get handed one copy of the check and are basically told "you need to figure it out". After lots of asking we finally got multiple copies to try and make sense of the confusing bill. This whole process takes us 40 minutes of struggling with the staff to clarify the bill as if it just too much trouble for them despite the place being less than half full. We ended up missing a show in Vegas we wanted to attend dealing with this fiasco.

As we start paying, the real fun begins. We are told by one of the servers in a very condescending and rude tone "well, maybe they do that at Denny's but we dont do it here" in regards to the poor service with the check. It seemed to be a personal shot based on being from the convention. Also, when asked why we are not being taken care of as is a servers job.. He replies "is it my job?" as if he would be doing as little as possible for the 20 percent tip. The older waiter over hearing the conversation was clearly embarrassed by his colleagues remarks.

Sorry but there are too many other great steak houses in Vegas to deal with lazy and insulting staff. Perhaps he should not have been so judgmental. I work for a Fortune 100 company and like to take clients to dinner. I make a good living and I am highly educated, I dont eat at Denny's thanks.  I don't need this garbage. Guess who isn't taking any clients here anymore?

P.S. Denny's probably has a spot on their overnight staff for your rude server. He obviously can't handle this gig.
Food was one of a kind. The decor and the energy is great. Will come back with out a doubt

Prices were reasonable for a steakhouse in Vegas. I have mixed reviews on the service. The server was a little bit abrasive, but other workers were helpful and nice. I ordered the bone in rib eye and thought that the meat quality was really good; however, the meat lacked flavor. I have definitely had better, but I guess it's a good place to check out for the old school vibes.

Also, we ordered the caesar salad. It's made from scratch... meaning they make the dressing in front of you. It was an interesting experience and it tasted pretty good.

The worst service in Las Vegas. I've had better service at McDonald's. At least the cashier at McDonald's asks if I would like fries with that. Not Golden Steer. The waiter doesn't want to talk to you. When your sideless dish arrives, before you can say, "Where's my potato", the waiter is gone, not to be seen again. Your beer is poured with the same finesse one uses to dump trash down a sink, and drink that beer slowly because it will be the last beer you'll be offered. In summary, if you want to eat at a restaurant with the worst service in Las Vegas, listening to the clientele boister about having posterior intercourse with a prostitute, Golden Steer is the place for you.

I recently had an amazing experience at the Golden Steer.  This place is full on old school Vegas and I had NEVER heard of it.  I was fortunate enough to be invited to a dinner party here by a friend's boss, who reserved a room and treated close to 20 people to an amazing meal.  had I come on my own, my experience may not have been so amazing, but this was awesome.   

First, I felt like I'd gone back in time when I entered, then the staff was all dressed formally and the bartenders looked like they had been here since Sinatra was last here.

Our meal was a whirlwind of deliciousness.  We were started with a platter of cold seafood: lobster, crab, oysters, and shrimp with the appropriate accompaniments. There was yummy bread and butter, then our meals came.  Several at my table had prime rib, there were a few different steaks and a friend at another table went all out with the lobster!  We also had sides of mashed potatoes, creamed spinach and sauteed mushrooms.  I had ordered a baked potato and it was seriously one of the biggest potatoes I've ever seen!  Everything I ate was delicious.

We had beverages on our own dime and I have to say the whiskey sour was PERFECT.  We were definitely too full for desserts, but overall, we felt super spoiled, especially since all we paid for was our drinks!

The place was clean and cool looking.  You really feel like your in old Vegas  

The ONLY reason why I didn't go for a full 5 stars is that our main waiter was a little odd - kind of brusque and then he jacked up our drink bill and was kind of snotty about it.  But otherwise, LOVE LOVE LOVED the experience!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, but keep in mind, it's PRICEY!

It's a hard to find a pretty AMAZING BLOW YOUR SOCKS OFF RESTAURANT on Groupon. But here we have it. The BEST groupon I have ever bought. Among the best pieces of steak I have ever had, in such a beautiful setting. What a find!!

Caesars salad made fresh, from scratch (including the dressing) right in front of you. Do not leave without ordering one. Best Caesar salad ever.

Outstanding service. Polite, kind, diligent, and enthusiastic waiters in tuxedos who LOVE their jobs. Our waiter had been there some 20+ years I think, and many of the others looked like they had seniority. He was so passionate about the restaurant, the owners and the food. I love that!

LOVELY ambiance. Oh how deceiving the outside is. The restaurant is off the strip in a strip mall with no windows. I was scared to walk in. Walked in , and loved it. Old hollywood indeed. And tuxed out waiters to top it off.  
 
Finally the food. Porterhouse was OUT OF THIS WORLD. Amazing. Juicy. Perfect. Generous portion... Great for sharing.

Nothing more you can ask for. And with the groupon, the price was even great. Although with everything they offer, I'd go back in a heart beat, and pay full price... If I lived in Vegas :(

We have been coming here for many, many, many years. Haven't been for the past 5 years or so, decided to re-visit some old school charm! No sooner were we seated that we were asked what we wanted to drink and what we wanted to order. I had to explain we were in no hurry to order dinner, wanted a drink first. While waiting for our one drink and bottle of wine, two more servers appeared to ask for our order.  Finally we gave in, not even 1/2 way through our drinks. Caesar salad still served tableside, server overdid the oil so all you tasted was oil. Ordered the filet, medium rare, was served to me raw+, sent it back and within seconds (no time whatsoever) to cook was served to me again and yep, raw, couldn't even cut it with a knife. Seriously? The best steakhouse in Las Vegas...not anymore. Decided not to chance a 3rd time. The baked potato was a baked potato. The béarnaise that was served with the first filet, sat there and got cold while someone in the kitchen attempted to cook the filet to medium rare.  The veal parmesan was adequate. Nothing special so much sauce you couldn't see the veal. They did remove the filet from our check and offered dessert but by that time we were so aggravated we paid our bill and left. Nothing like it used to be with the exception of the restaurant itself. Lastly, they need to get some servers who speak English. Don't bother, go to CUT inside the Palazzo.

Finally made it to this place. My gf made a reservation for us and her mom, who is here from TX. Pretty unbalanced experience. The food was actually really good for the most part. We ordered the escargot and Caesar salad for the table to start. Escargot was nice, but I can't say much for the Caesar salad. It was prepared table side, which is nice, but too much dressing and too garlicy for me. I am a big fan of Caesar salad and this didn't really do it for me. 
Now this is where the experience took a turn. We told our server that we had a Groupon and it's like his entire attitude changed after that. He became short and never came by. We ordered an 18oz Prime Rib and a chicken dish. This took over an hour and I always order my prime rib RARE. The few times we were actually able to flag our server down during this hour, he said he had another table that he had to help prior to us, and he said this several times. We finally told him I had to go to work, which I did, and been there about an hour and a half at this point. Food came out, Prime Rib was ok. Not the best I've had. The angel chicken and mushroom dish was awesome. We also got creamed spinach and it was just way too rich. Overall the food was fine like I said. 
So after we were done eating our server comes and gives us our check. He could of asked if we wanted desert or maybe bring one on the house since I waited over an hour for a rare Prime Rib? Naw, he doesn't roll like that. He said, said we told him we needed to leave is there anything else? I was thinking desert, but he just made me feel like I was wrong for saying anything in the first place. He then brought a little credit card machine, pointed to the gratuity part and made sure to point out the original total before the groupon discount..again like he wasn't getting a proper tip, which was his attitude towards the whole thing from the beginning. It was like beyond obvious. 
So if people ever read my reviews I rarely go off on service like this or ever really. But this guy single handedly ruined our experience. So after all that I am still giving 3 stars, because of the food and the atmosphere. I just don't think will be back.

Food was INCREDIBLE!  The atmosphere is very old school vegas and the service is amazing!!  Don't let the weird exterior fool you.  This place is a classic steakhouse and so fantastic.  I also, would like to give a huge shout out to the Valentines Day photographer who mastered the art of avoiding the double chin in what turned out to be some of my fav pics of my boyfriend and I.

I absolutely adore this place like no other in town. Some of the best food around, and your standard low key dark old Vegas atmosphere. 

The servers are always top notch and I've never had a bad meal here. Bad dates here, but never a bad meal.

Full disclosure: I don't eat red meat. That being said this place was still delightful. I had an incredible table side Caesar salad and twice baked potato. Service was decent. I was told the steak was delicious. I loved the vibe too. Ill be back!

This use to be a great treasure spot to recommend newbies to, but something has drastically changed in last two visits in two months, the service for a party of 4 that exceeded $600 was the absolute worst I ever had anywhere at a caliber of this kind of restaurant. I have been going to Golden Steer in excess of 25 years and probably responsible for over $75,000 + in last 6 years from hosting private party's and recommendations. What a shame on a legendary place with so so much history.

Original padded leather booths, stiff drinks, table side Caesar salads done right and a gracious staff that OWN what they do not to mention some terrific steak.

if you're looking for real in a city that can be considered (mostly) fake this place is IT.
No visit to LV is complete without a dinner here.

Thank you Golden Steer!

My coworkers and I go here for a nice dinner about once a month and it is our favorite place in Vegas, hands down!!! The service is incredible, the steaks are amazing and their wine selection is top notch (for those that wish to drink). Things to try: chilled seafood appetizer, filet, Caesar salad (prepared table side), filet and lobster, and the creme brûlée.

Love it! Love it! Love it!  It is The Classic Steakhouse, that has ambiance galore.  The steak is the star and they definitely show it off!  The food is of the highest quality and the beverages are fabulous!  The Flamingo Martini is a requirement.  This is a must in Vegas!  If you are there, make a reservation and ask for Tom K., he is hands down THE BEST!  Excellent service, recommendations and a personality that will make you laugh and warm your heart!  There is nothing better than a dinner here - I cannot wait to go back!

The food and ambiance were above average.  We ordered the French Onion soup, the crab cakes, a prime 8 ounce filet, and the king crab legs.  The prices were comparable to other high end steak restaurants. Drink orders were fill promptly but food orders took a little more time than expect for the amount of diners that were in the restaurant.  The server (his name was Jay) seemed pretentious and to have a classist attitude. I don't know if it was because we were the youngest ones in the place or not.  The waiters attitude wasn't bad enough to give this place a 3 star rating until we got our bill.  Our bill came (didn't have the our gratuity added to it yet) and it seemed right so I paid with a gift card.  When I got the charge slip back it showed my remaining balance on my gift card to be lower that it should have been.  I called my gift card to see how much was charged and it was $30 OVER what was printed on the charge slip.  We called the waiter over the inquire why my gift card was overcharged.  He said that the tip was already included in the bill.  I told him that he had no idea what we were going to tip and that gratuity was not automatically included with only a party of two.  He then got the manager who ran the card with my tip (which was 20% of the bill - $29.13) and said that it ran without a problem.  No apology given by the waiter or the manager was given.  This seemed highly dubious to me.  The pre-tip charge slip must have been printed and voided out and then reran for the higher amount.  It felt like the waiter was trying to guarantee himself a 20% tip without our knowledge.  The way the waiter and manager handled it felt like this fraudulent activity is a very common occurrence at this establishment.  My advice to anyone frequenting this establishment is to thoroughly inspect your bill and to pay CASH only.  It was an unfortunate event that ruined and otherwise pleasant dining experience.

Jay, gave me the worst service, ever! He reached across a couple of our guests to serve drinks and when he finally got around to taking our dinner order, at his leisure. All of our drinks were empty, and that didn't seem to bother him either. And amidst him taking the time out of his busy schedule to take our order( with 3 other tables in the place), he proceeds to tap his hand on his crossed arms. One of our group mentioned that we must have pissed off the waiter.  Steaks, tough! Feel free to check out my other reviews. I am never negative about restaurants, but this one took the cake. The only reason it was given 3 stars was because of the atmosphere. So if tou dont care about the food being good, or the service being worth a darn, well this is your kind of place!!

Five of us had dinner here last Thursday night (11/4) and it was incredible.
The food-steaks, prime rib, Caesar salad, creamed spinach and creamed corn were the best. Service was impeccable and Rika(sp) the hostess was a real treat.  Don't hesitate to go, you won't be sorry.
Over priced, tough steak, blan potatoes. The waiter had a pretentious attitude, . We will never patronize this establishment again.

From the outside this restaurant doesn't look like much. But once you get inside its an old Vegas feel where you would see the mob having dinner (back in the day) . 
Our waiters were amazing. They were all very funny and friendly. They wear suits but their personalities were not as you would think of with a waiter with a suit but their personalities were laid back and just overall friendly and humorous. 
The food was amazing. We were offered to try their clam chowder which Im usually picky about this kind of soup but it was really good. We were also given a tasting of a cabernet they had and it went perfect with the  18oz prime I had....and it was cooked perfectly and served with delicious creamy and fresh horseradish. After dinner we were served a complimentary cheesecake with the most sparkly candle ...what a nice surprise from our funny waiter. We also ordered Dirty martini's for after dinner cocktails. After dinner our waiter kindly called us a cab.

My parents, my cousin and her husband, and my gf and I went to the Golden Steer awhile back. My gf used to go here a lot when she was in college and always talked about it, how awesome it used to be to get a serious steak dinner in an old school steakhouse with charisma and old school charm. Johnny the original bartender is still there, been told he's been there for 50+ years. (I bet he has some stories)

Being from the Midwest and raising cattle my parents love a good steak. And my cousin and her husband are cowboys(girls) from Red River NM and they love a nice piece of meat as well.  This was perfect, they were all staying at the Flamingo Hilton (behind the flamingo tower) and I swung by to pick them up.  Being so close to the strip it's an easy trek up LV Blvd from flamingo.  We walked in and were immediately greeted and escorted to a table in the middle of the room, we wouldn't all fit in the few booths available. The place was remarkably quiet for the amount of people in there, a huge group of Texans with cowboy hats occupied a table of about 12 in the middle of the room but they kept it down even though there were about 4 bottles of wine empty on the table already haha.

I ordered the Ribeye and it was out of this world. Such a big piece of meat!!!! Ribeye is my favorite cut of steak, the marbling is perfect in this cut and it holds a flavor really well. Some cuts of steak that you try to season never really hold a marinade but ribeyes do. I had the baked potato and it was huge as well, I didn't finish it all.

My whole family still talks about their experience at "that steakhouse" in Vegas talking about how big and reasonably prices the food is. And they're from the Midwest where prices are about 60% of Vegas standards for the same quality and size of steaks so that's saying something.  
Will definitely be back someday. Still waiting for a steakhouse to do better than this in this town, however there have been a few that are close to comparable. 
Overall experience was 5 stars, Can't wait for my parents to come back so we can go again (since they paid (: )

This was the best steak dinner I've ever had!  My family and I had been looking forward to this dinner for months. The ambience and history of the restaurant make the dinner that much more memorable. We ordered 3 cuts: 2 bone in 22 oz ribeyes, 1 - 16 oz New York strip and 1 diamond Jim cut prime rib that was 24 oz. we started with the seafood stuffed mushrooms and ordered 3 sides to split between the four of us, which was more than enough to share and we had leftovers: creamed spinach, twice baked potato and sautéed mushrooms. We ended the meal with a shared order of the table side prepared bananas foster - to die for. It had this amazing pop of orange zest. Best I've ever had by far. On top of this amazing dinner, the staff is fantastic. They interacted with us and made the experience even more memorable. We come to Vegas at least once a year to visit family and this has always been on our list to try and I'm so glad we did.

I personally didn't think anything about this place stood out from any other steakhouse I've been to. My ribeye was huge, tasted like any other steak I've had and my twice baked potato was really good. My boyfriend had a lobster tail and New York strip combo. His lobster he enjoyed but the steak he did not. It was very chewy and flavorless. The service was excellent! Paid $260 including tip for just the two of us.
Great steaks and sides. Traditional steakhouse, very good service. Worth the trip.

Golden Steer is a Vegas classic, steeped in Rat Pack lore. My friend, who steered us to the Steer, insisted on booking Sinatra's booth, and book it we did. Initially indifferent, I must admit there was a certain feeling of cool sitting in the booth where Ol' Blue Eyes used to sit. We debated whether there was enough room in the booth for the entire Pack. I argued there was only room enough for Frank and up to 2 broads. This was confirmed when we noticed similar booths tagged with the names of Dean Martin and the rest.

The dark, classy back-room ambiance is definitely a throwback to a gone-by era of guys and dolls, gangster and dames. Just ask one of the waiters for a story from the old days...Though most of the staff is younger, there is  a guy who looks like he time-traveled from 1960 to make  you a table-side Caesar salad--which, by the way, is just what he does when you order one.

Steak was uniformly excellent. Even though I'd already eaten dinner and didn't order food, my friends were nice enough to offer me cuts of their meat. The New York Strip, which was mistakenly delivered to my friend who ordered filet mignon but did not mind, was juicy even at medium.

They also make a mean Old Fashioned, about the only thing on the menu that I actually ordered for myself.

On the way out, my friend confused two Canadian businessmen in town for CES for waitstaff, thanking them for a wonderful night. Oops, but the verdict was right.

PS: You already know this, but make sure your wallet is stuffed with Grants and Benjamins and your credit card is loaded before venturing in.

We visited the Golden Steer for the first time on Sunday night, and are so glad to have found this place. We love eating, we love Vegas, we love places with character, and places with great service. Golden Steer hit all of these marks. We live in San Diego but come to Vegas multiple times a year- that being said, we will DEFINITELY be back. We've done the celebrity chef route time and time again, but in my opinion, you can't beat a place that probably hasn't changed since the day it opened its doors. If it aint broken, don't fix it. The service was also great. Our waiters were very friendly and knowledgeable about the establishment, telling us about the history of the restaurant, as well as the fact that it might be haunted! 
Highlights- table side caesar salad, both our prime rib and steak were cooked to perfection. The only downside is, my stomach isn't big enough to eat everything. Next time, we will definitely save room for the bananas foster or cherries jubilee!

Went here on a whim. Food was great overall, and the service was amazing. Classic steakhouse feel with old Vegas flavor. I cannot stress enough how well we were treated and every request was catered to perfectly. Would come back again.

We love Vegas steakhouses. We had waited until we had visitors in town to try this one. We wish we would've waited longer.

We are fine with paying top price for top quality. The Golden Steer is neither. You are overpaying for it's name and the fact it's Vegas' oldest steakhouse.

The ambiance is great, and thats why it get ONE star. Very "old-school" Vegas. The service is absolutely horrible. There were 4 of us. Our head waiter greeted us in the most annoyed and lethargic way. Two separate people asked us which type of water we wanted. We only saw our waiter to greet us, take our order, and ask us for dessert.

We order the "famous" garlic bread to start. It was extremely "crumby" and pretty tasteless. 

Each of us ordered some kind of steak or prime rib. The meat was okay. Nothing to write home about. We also ordered the "world's largest baked potato". Again, nothing special here. One of our other sides was sautéed mushrooms. Unbeknownst to us, they are mushroom buttons and not sliced mushrooms. 

The final time we saw our waiter, he was there to ask us if we wanted dessert....he REEKED like an ashtray. It was clear he had just finished a smoke break. He absolutely STUNK. And when he brought our bill, he had double charged us for the garlic bread (I mention this because after reading other Yelp comments, this seems to be a recurring problem).

If you want a great steakhouse which is worth it's weight in gold, go to Hugo's Cellar at Four Queens or Hank's at Green Valley Ranch. I promise you won't over pay for what you are getting.

This was a huge disappointment for us. We were really looking forward to this restaurant.

Great service food is just mediocre .. I have been to tons of steakhouses in Vegas and this one falls short of the hype. We had the calamari, Caesar salad , prime rib, creamed spinach, bone in ribeye , petite filet and shrimp scampi. Their hollandaise sauce needs flavor and the rest of the food needed to be salted which is not something I normally do. Would unfortunately not come back

Worth the price for the atmosphere alone! Great steaks! All the courses were wonderful, Petite filet Oscar, T-bone, best Caesar salad ever, prawns the size of a short man's hand, toasted ravioli, fantastic cheesecake! Very nice of staff to celebrate birthday for us. A couple of loud mouth millennials without the capacity to follow unspoken rules of decorum should have been ejected, lucky for them Tony Spilatro wasn't there! Other than that, what a wonderful dining experience! Thank you Golden Steer for a wonderful night out in Old School Cool Vegas!

If you are looking for a flavor of old school Las Vegas, while at the same time have the best steak in in town, then Golden Steer is a must. The staff are amazing and so knowledgeable about the history of this great place. If you haven't been, treat yourself.

This was our first visit to The Golden Steer Restaurant in Las Vegas on Dec 8 ,2016. The waiter was prompt and attentive. The shrimp cocktail, Caesar Salads were great. Our main entrees, prime rib and a bone in rib eye, both cooked medium rare were a huge disappointment. We were unable to enjoy our main course since they were both tough and chewy. We left them on the plate and did not ask for a take out box. Needless to say this was our first and last visit to The Golden Steer. At 200.00 for a meal for two- one would expect more.

The Golden Steer is a Las Vegas classic. The ambiance alone is worth the trip. The sides and starters were average but my 12 oz. filet Oscar style was fantastic. The bananas foster made table side was great as well. Service is wonderful and this restaurant is definitely a must for any local or just anyone who is interested in a classic Vegas dining experience.
The steak was good... Very cool old gangster atmosphere. This place has some old roots... Cool restaurant.

Our experience could not have been better!  From the moment we walked in we were treated like royalty.  We were immediately shown to a table and ordered drinks.  From there, we had appetizers, more drinks, and our entrees.  After ordering beer and blood marys, we had oysters rockefeller, clams casino, veal marsala, twice baked potatoes, lyonnaise potatoes, toasted raviolis (which were a bonus as we didn't order them), and creamed corn.  I swear I could have stayed for 2 days!  I mentioned that I had a Groupon and not an eyelash was batted.  They retrieved it from my phone and we moved on without missing a beat.  Every single staff member was impeccably dressed, courteous, and accommodating.  I really did feel like I was "Rat Pack" worthy, all the way down the music being played.  We finished dinner and still managed to have enough leftovers to fill a bag. (We don't eat a lot but like to try a lot of different things.)  After paying the check and leaving the restaurant, we were called back by a staff member.  It seems Groupon automatically adds the gratuity and I had added another on top.  I find it refreshing and ethical that they would hurry out to find us to let me alter the total.  We have definitely added a new "regular" place to vist on every trip. I can't believe I didn't know about them before, but believe you me, I'll never forget them!!  Next time I'm asking for Sheckie Greene's table so my butt can sit in the same grooves as his!
great food, delicious shrimp and steak.. the lobster was best i ever had

Well, I turned 60 yesterday and my wife and I wanted to go somewhere for a nice relaxing, memorable dinner. Looked for a steak house and thought why not, let's give Golden Steer a try, lots of history and old...like me. I'm actually older by a couple years
Inside was old fashion décor of years past, very inviting and a nice ambiance. Waiters and servers were very friendly. 
Ordered the combo New York and Lobster dinner. The lobster was fantastic, the steak was just a bit overcooked from what I ordered, wanted medium rare, got medium. My waiter was more than happy to get me a new one but, I struggle with throwing a good piece of meat away. It was only a little overcooked and I thanked him for the offer.
One of the most incredible taste is the table side made Caesar salad. They make the dressing right in front of you, super fresh and OMG flavor. Best ever. The French onion soup is very good as well.
So when I start eating my dinner, things take a turn. They make an incredible Bananas Foster table side. And a few tables away was one being made. To start with they light a firework sparkler thing, like a fountain. Really nice for show but, it filled the entire room with a horrible sulfur smelling smoke. I mean it lingered for 10 minutes plus. Completely ruined my experience eating my meal. My nostrils and my taste buds where ruined for the night. From what I hear, on a busy night there could be 40 of these things going off during your meal. So sorry to give a not too impressive review but for the money, you didn't match my expectations.

Forget eating at half the hotel steak houses. This has to be my favorite in Vegas.

Love the decor and the ambiance 

We came early so we were seated immediately. By the time we left at 7 it was packed 

The hostess was extremely pleasant and the waiter was superb. Helped guide us after a bunch of questions as to what would be best to eat 

Clams casino were pretty good
Filet mignon cut like butter. And it was cooked perfectly - medium rare. Has the double backed potato and it was awesome. Then I had dessert, cherry jubilee. Holy cow. Amazing 


My buddy had the t bone and creamed spinach. Also excellent. 

Can't wait to go back. 

JG

Met early for business dinner. Got drinks at the bar to start. Bartender (forgot his name but Hispanic guy) scooped ice w the glass and then packed the ice in with his bare palm. Gross!!!..call the Health Dept!!  Bartending 101..use an ice scoop and don't handle money and paperwork and then touch ice or rim of glass w your nasty bare hand. Barf!!! 

Shortly after we went to be seated in dining room and specifically asked to transfer tab. Same bartender said they don't do that and they are separate and we had to close out. 2 of us are locals and work in restaurants and know that is a greedy scam and a lie. Obviously he wanted the tip instead of transferring for one tab like any high class restaurant offers to do. Then he hands the credit card machine to the one paying and asked him to press the button equivalent to the percent tip he wanted to leave.  Bartender didn't bother telling him grat was already included for our party of 9. So embarrassing seeing someone so hard up for a tip scheming for money. Nobody goes there and wants to scam you out of a tip when they have no problem paying $60 for a steak so relax.   Go be a cabbie you sheisty hack..and wash your hands! 

Oysters and apps were good. Table side caesar was nothing great. We only wanted 8, but they made 9, took the extra one away, and charged us for 9 anyway. Guess this is a tourist trap where they figure no one looks at the bill that goes on the company card anyway and that's how they make a few extra bucks that probably really adds up. 3 of us got steak Oscar (2 ordered medium rare and one medium) but all 3 filets were dry.  Tsk tsk. The guy that got the pasta enjoyed his dish though :-/.

Think it's just a place you go for the history and nostalgia.  The rest is out w old Vegas standards and in with the new cookie cutter garbage.

My experience was mediocre.  The service was as expected but not exceptional.  The food was good, but not exceptional.  At this price point, my food experiences have been memorable and worthy of wish listing a revisit.  Golden Steer doesn't make the cut.  

As for the decor, in a city of themes, this does not stand out.  I believe there is a way to honor the "old school" history and stay updated with lighting, menu, and decor.  

Should you decide to try for yourself, I'll advise not to "fall" for the upsell of caesar salad.  Just because it's made tableside it is not special.  For $12 each person I feel ripped off.  

If you order steamed asparagus, request sauce otherwise it is too naked.  Anyone can steam asparagus, I'd like something I cannot accomplish at home.  I did not find that here.

The rib-eye is $54 bone in.  There was perhaps 6-8oz of meat, the rest was grizzle and fat.  Total weight from the menu, 22 oz.  Go for the filet of 12 oz for $48.  

The crab cakes had little filler, but were wimpy/limpy pan fried, I think.  The cocktail sauce was actually pretty good, but this gets a mediocre rating as well.  We could not discuss this during tasting due to the Mr. Caesar Salad at our table tossing and making a show of the salad.

So there you have it.  I could have given 3 stars had I paid $75, but the bill was $160, plus tip.  I'll go elsewhere.

Experience the Rat Pack era with an evening at thi old school Las Vegas Steakhouse.  The steaks are good, the drinks are strong and the service is old school fantastic, as if they know exactly what you are thinking. I have ha the bone-in ribeye and the filet mignon... My preference is the filet.

The Golden Steer is not only the oldest steak house in Las Vegas, but it's also one of the tastiest.    The ambiance is classy and the staff are dressed to the "T".  We of course got the table side Cesar salad, as recommended by many fellow yelpers and also the fried calamari, which for a place in the middle of the desert was delicious!  For an entree, I got the bone in rib-eye, which was honestly one of the juiciest and delicious steaks to which I've ever indulged myself.  This accompanied with a twice baked potato was the perfect classic meat and potatoes meal.  My only regret was not being able to finish everything and get dessert.  Next time!

If you are looking for a great spot for a classic meal or an anniversary or birthday dinner and happen to be in Vegas.  Give this spot a shot, you won't regret it!

Unseasoned is the name of the game.

I thought the ambiance was 5 stars.  I thought the wait staff was 4-5 stars.  We sat at the DiMaggio booth and the vibe of the place was really quite terrific.

The food, on the other hand... tasted really bland and dated.  We ordered the Chateaubriand for two.  The temperature on the steak was perfect.  However, there was not a lick of salt or pepper on either the vegetables or the meat.  I don't just mean that it was underseasoned, either... it literally tasted like a steak for someone who isn't allowed to consume added salt.  I'm not sure how can you leave cooked asparagus or broccoli unsalted?!

The dish did come with bernaise and hollandaise, and I presume that this was meant as the seasoning agent... but even still, the steak and veggies should have been seasoned.

The food was a massive letdown.  If they could just salt their dishes, then I think you have a winner.
If your looking for that "old vegas" style restaurant.  Golden Steer is your place! still on of the best pieces of meat in the city

I WILL NEVER STEP FOOT INSIDE THIS JOINT AGAIN! We made advanced reservations for 8. When we arrived we were told they overbooked and we'd have to wait. The receptionist was very unprofessional and rude, telling us tables weren't available when we could clearly see empty tables from the waiting room. She even said that we could leave if we didn't want to wait. After she was told by my wife, son and daughter who made 3 separate status requests, we left. Maybe our money wasn't green enough, OR IS IT THEY DONT SERVE BLACK PEOPLE! Somebody needs to tell them the year is 2013...not the 1950's

Old school Vegas best describes this landmark place close to the strip.   Table side Caesar prep and banana foster and cherries jubilee are highlights.  Wait service is very attentive.  Another highlight was the side of creamed corn.  For a date night or longing for Vegas of old...This is your place.
I have been wanting to go here for years. The Golden Steer has old Las Vegas charm. The staff is attentive and friendly. The food & wine is amazing. This is one of my new favorite spots.
Food was amazing!!! Best Service I have ever had!! Fast! Food was great we had two Surf n Turf's amazing!! Ask for Tom Kehoe!!

Golden Steer is 5 star through and through. I'd give them 10 stars if I could. From the staff, the food, and last but not least, the old school Vegas feel and look, the Golden Steer is a night out that will not disappoint. Please do yourself a favor and order the table side presentation caesar salad. The best caesar I have ever had. Had the filet and it is outstanding. The baked potatoes are the largest, and best, I have ever seen. And to top it off, the bananas foster table side presentation is the best way to top this fabulous dinner off.  The staff, Alfredo especially, are among the best in the city. Even Fabian, who has been serving there for 40 years, is a treat to interact with. We were lucky enough to sit in Elvis Presley's booth he sat in when he frequented GS. Of course if you would like to sit in Dean's booth, Franks table, or Sammy's as well, all are represented. The GS is worth the cab ride from any resort you may be staying at while in Vegas. It is an original icon and separates itself from the celebrity chef themed steak houses of the strip. Whether your celebrating a special event or are just wanting a great steak in an original, one of a kind environment, the Golden Steer will not disappoint.

Started off seeing a physical golden steer off the side of the road.  I was curious.  I thought maybe it was a bar or something in a little strip mall.
It ended up being a steak restaurant in an old strip mall.  It had some good reviews so I thought I would give it a try.

I was amazed when I walked in the door.  It was gorgeous inside.  Stained glass windows, nice upholstery, the lighting was good.  A hostess/waitress came over and welcomed us.  We said we were just looking and they said go ahead, walk around.

We decided to come back and eat here.  The 2nd visit was just as friendly.  We were seated at a beautiful booth.  The Hostess told us the history of the establishment.  The mobsters used to meet in the back where they had a special back door so they could get out fast if the cops arrived and in the 60's when Sammy Davis Jr could not stay in the hotels on the strip that he played at nor eat in their restaurants, he and his friends would come and eat there.   They still have his original booth with the same upholstery.  Very cool.  I love hearing the history about places.

We ordered the Caesars Salad, Steak, Prime Rib, and Asparagus.
Caesers Salad was made fresh at our table and was incredible.  I would come here just for the salad.
Both the steak and the Prime Rib were cooked exactly to our liking.  My husband likes Medium well and I like Black in Blue (rare&cold on the inside and just browned on the outside).

The asparagus was perfect.  Crisp, but cooked with a light sauce that was equally delicious.
I will come here again.

We also saw the next table over having a birthday.  Their dessert came with sparklers and singing. :)

Worst experience ever went there and food was horrible, customer was awful and then called to speak with manager mark who never returned my call so I call back and speak with risha the women manager who said oh I only work two days a week and said I will look into it and call you back by Sunday that was 3 weeks ago not sure what Sunday she was going to be. Place needs to close doors. Sad cause we used to go there all the time. Wish I could give zero stars

This place is amazingly delicious, a gem hidden just off LV Boulevard next to a bank of other food joints.  We went for my birthday and were not at all disappointed!  It felt like real Vegas old school swank -- the old oil paintings of the West, the tuxedo-clad waiters doing a nice tableside Caesar salad, the giant steaks that are cooked right and moist.  


 I wonder if Elvis had a giant roman candle jabbed into his slice of birthday cake, too?  It lit the entire room up for 45 seconds.  That's the Golden Steer -- doing it big, doing it right.

I have been here a few times... Work team dinners, and most recently, I took my husband here after our wedding in Vegas! (We live in Henderson). 

Con:

When I took my husband there the last time, I have to say that the food was  5 star experience. It was even better than usual. However, the server was rather pushy. 
We ordered a bottle of wine, 2 appetizers, 2 filet dinners with 2 sides.  Even the server himself (as they always do) reminded us of how "ridiculously large" the portion sizes are. Yet the server became visibly angry and downright pushy when I said NO to desert. That's not how you treat a local for their wedding dinner.  Especially after the AMOUNT that I had ordered. 

Pros:
That lousy waiter aside, I love this place. The service is NORMALLY ok... a few bad apples here and there... The food, I feel, is delicious if you enjoy a good steak. 

The price is a bit high, but it's not everywhere in Vegas where you can experience "OLD Vegas."

The baked potatoes are delicious - and GIANT. 

I also enjoy the french onion soup and the lobster bisque. 

Overall, I've never had a bad meal here - ever. I also enjoy the bar from time to time. The bartender is always great and the drinks are not bad.
2nd time here and it was amazing both times.  Alfredo was our server but the entire staff was friendly and helpful.  We love the food and the atmosphere!!

Next door to Capprioti's Sandwich Shop.

While staying a couple nights at The Sahara Casino/Hotel I ventured in for a steak dinner. Not knowing what to expect, I was greeted by the beautiful hostess who asked if I would be dining alone and I told her it was just me tonight. I asked about how I was dressed and if it was appropriate (shorts, collared silk shirt and flip-flops), she was cool with it. There were a few tables of people wearing golf hats, tennis shoes - Dressy? I dont think they mind.

Sat in the Mickey Rooney booth right next to the Elvis Presley booth. The Kings booth sat an extra 3-4 people. Im sure the King brought more folks in than MR ever did.

Wish I had eaten at the bar however, as I felt a little out of place with all the other groups and couples. No sweat, it worked out fine in the dining room.

Enjoyed the petite filet mignon with whipped potatoes and a stiff Jack and Coke.

The steak was almost perfect. A little overdone on the edges. The potatoes were the best Ive had!

I overheard one of the waiters saying he had worked there for 21 years. He was very helpful and attentive as were everyone else that night. I liked how the waiters were equipped with a little flashlight to help you see the menus in this dimly lit, schwanky joint!

From the outside, this place just looks like its going to do you right. Bravo.

Went to Golden Steer for our anniversary.  After reading some poor reviews, I was pleasantly surprised at the wonderful, friendly and efficient service.  The atmosphere was really old time Vegas, the staff from the greeting till we left were terrific. The prices may be high for some guests, but absolutely worth every dime.  We had the Caesar Salad for 2.. it was to die for.. omg haven't had that great of a salad in many years. BTW they also knew I had a groupon and we were not treated any different than anyone else in the dining area.  Thank you Golden Steer we will be returning.

At Golden Steer I finally found a ribeye steak better than I can make at home.  If you are a steak lover and in Vegas make the effort to find this place.  Everything about this ribeye was right - the quality of the meat, the proper melted marbling, the correct seasoning and the temperature.  Just fantastic!  If you order a potato be sure to have someone along to share it - it's huge!  If you looking for the best steak rather than the coolest atmosphere this place should be your destination.

Went with a bunch of friends on a Saturday night when we were in Vegas. Our waiter was great, very nice and helpful...

Although. Two of us got Caesar salads and mine came out right away and hers came during dinner, neither were made table side. The waiter got the wrong wine for my friend and said he would take care of it, he didn't get her another glass on the house or do ANYTHING about it. The food is extremely overpriced, but it's a steakhouse in Vegas.

Our waiter then brought out four desserts for our "birthdays" which was fun, but we didn't want all of that dessert and then felt the need to tip him. We asked for a dessert menu and he brought a bunch of desserts instead.

I purposefully didn't get my own steak, just had a few bits of my husbands, because I knew I wouldn't be able to eat it all...but still, I don't know - $120 for one steak, a twice baked potato, a Caesar salad and a glass of wine seems excessive, but we overtipped because of all of the desserts we didn't eat.

It was a good experience but we won't be back.

This place is quite simply amazing. 
It was recommended to me so I thought I would try it out. 
The service was perfect. The food was absolutely incredible. I had one of the best steaks I have ever had. 
If you want to have something that is old Vegas. Then you should go here. Absolutely amazing!

I felt like I went back in time at this joint.  The history the ambiance.  It's like being in the Godfather.  

They know their crowd.  It's those nostalgic for the Rat Pack. I wouldn't consider myself one of those people, but I can appreciate the history and their major feat to keep that special feeling.

We got a small tour of the restaurant, learned a bit of the history before the meal.  

The food keeps with the theme.  Very classic dishes from the era.  I enjoyed my meal there very much.  It wasn't outstanding and perhaps a bit overpriced, But the overall experience lender itself to being an experience of old Vegas.
Food was great!  Service not so great...  When you're paying that much for a meal, the service should be just as good as the food.  Get the bananas foster for dessert, you won't be disappointed!

The best steak I have had in years! Stephanie was definitely the hostess with the mostess! The table side made Caesar salad was fresh and crispy and the dressing was ooo lala. I would give this restaurant a FIVE STAR.

There is one constant when I go to Vegas.  I will ALWAYS eat at Golden Steer.  I will always get phenomenal service.  I will always get a wonderful steak cooked to perfection.  And I will always feel like the Rat Pack should be dining with me.

This visit was no different.  The T-bone was cooked to perfection.  The whipped potatoes were a wonderful surprise.  The only difference on this visit was that I split a dessert.  The chocolate cake is every bit the equal of their steak.  It was a wonderful combination of moist cake and a milk chocolate mousse and a darker chocolate icing.  I'm normally an ice cream guy if I do dessert at all -- but that cake may well be the best dessert I've had in a long time.

The real star of the evening was our server, Scot.  Scot told us he'd only been at Golden Steer for a year, but you'd never know it.  Utterly impeccable service.  He knew the menu and virtually the entire wine list.  He knew the history of the restaurant and its place in Vegas lore.  He was friendly and chatty without being overly obtrusive.  

I look forward to my next trip to Vegas where I will go out of my way to have Scot take care of my steak cravings again.

This is THE steakhouse in Vegas. There are plenty of them in town, one in each hotel, but not with this old school vibe plus solid cocktails.  Tableside service is just plain fun and when's the last time you had Cherries Jubilee?  I love The Golden Steer and may drop into LV just to have a TBT.

They say that you shouldn't judge a book by it's cover, and this is definitely the case with The Golden Steer. From outside of the building you would never know what lies within. The facade looks like a cheesy run down Vegas spot, but inside the rich burgundy leather seating, crisp white linens, dim-but warm lighting, and pleasant atmosphere is anything bust cheesy and run down. The service is spectacular, the food is nothing less than perfect, and the over all experience is great. Locals and regular visitors alike love and frequent this place. On the more expensive side, but worth the price, the Golden Steer is a place where you are likely to find a high profile public figure or celebrity at the next table. It's a great place to treat yourself or your travel companions to a special dinner with your gambling winnings.

The 3 of us went here Saturday night, no waiting that should have been a clue. Sat down got a quick rundown on specials, ordering was fairly fast, service was spotty for the price of their food. Multiple people bringing you the order. Food was subpar for the price you pay. This place is living on it's past of the 60's and 70's. Nothing wowed us from the stuff we ordered, servings were small for the price. Would not come back here. Lots of other similarly priced places in Vegas with better service and quality of food. To the owners those that don't adjust get left with the times and this place is 20 years behind in quality and service.

I'm a fan of the Golden Steer! My friend brought me here on our first night in Vegas and we were all impressed with the friendly, attentive service and the great food. 

The tableside Caesar was tasty but could have used a bit more garlic in my opinion and the shrimp was awesome! Lots of garlic, a little white wine and a bit buttery.

My friends had steak and they loved it!

Overall, we loved the place, including the cool, retro decor. Next time we are in Vegas, we will be back. Thanks Golden Steer!

Want a decent cut of beef without the pretense, noise, long waits, or other nonsense on the strip and associated tourists? Eat here. 

Want to be hand fed lychee chocolate mousse while your waiter spins 500 feet in the air describing the sunset over Pahrump in between French accented recitations of poetically composed winelists and exploding white tigers backed by a Beatles soundtrack? Eat elsewhere. 

Best prime rib in town, pleasantly served at a reasonable price. A friend who's a local introduced me to this place a dozen years ago- since then,  I try to make it here at least once every time I visit the area.

Finally made it for dinner after decades of Vegas trips and other steak houses. 

Service was great and the food was excellent. Best part was the experience of dining where the stars and the mob of the past use to enjoy the riches of life. Old Vegas baby!

After reading all the positive reviews, I was very disappointed when we had dinner here. Service was marginally acceptable, though slow and we often had to flag down the server. 
I had Chicken of the Angels, and it was VERY salty. It was supposed to be served over mushrooms and artichokes, though my meal had one piece of one artichoke! The side of asparagus were ordered to shared was ice cold - and barely enough for one person. 
One person in my party ordered a steak medium (pink) and it was definitely well done. The baked potato was huge, and ice cold on the inside but steaming on the outside. 
At a restaurant like this (and for these prices) I shouldn't have to ask for a wine list, and the server should ask if we want a second round of drinks. 
Although this place is "historic" I think there are far better restaurants in town.

Golden Steer is a bit of old Las Vegas charm where you can get a traditional steak dinner where there's plenty of large leather booths, wine glasses, plates and napkins.   This place is something out of the 1950's that's appears not to have changed in years.  There's pictures of John Wayne and other's from that era on the walls.  You come here for a steak or some prime rib and the typical side dishes. 

We shared the bone end rib eye that was about 22 ounces and plenty to share between two people.  Got a bottle of wine and started off with some Oysters Rockefeller.  It was a simple dinner, but we were pretty full and didn't have the side dishes.

If you want to get off the strip and you're into old school steak houses, this is a good place to go and get away from the strip (about $20 taxi) and go back in time.

The best of the best in Las Vegas.  Best wait staff, best martinis, best caesar made at the table (!!!!!!!!!), best steaks - no steakhouse in Las Vegas can come close to Golden Steer.  And you get old school history to boot!  It just does not get better than this.

I wish I had a 'to be fair' line I could throw in here, but it's impossible. My wife and I ate at the Golden Steer on 5/16/13 (Her review is before the Golden Steer plant's review below mine.), and the food was simply horrible. For starters, we sat at the Marilyn Monroe table. Yes, the place has been open for a while, but they do stress the old star-power a bit much, making one wonder of the quality of the food. You'll see why I say this: 

When the bread and butter was brought out, we were eating it and noticed a really strange flavor. I tasted the butter on its own, and it tasted as if it had sat in the fridge for a very - very long time before being brought to our table. Sure we wanted to sit in Marilyn's booth, but we did not want to eat the same butter that was served to her!!! Right then and there I wanted to get out as fast as possible. Nevertheless, we decided to overlook this, notify the waiter, and give them another chance. He didn't bring out any more bread and butter, hence the bad butter must've been all they had. NOTE: Steak is often cooked with butter....

The ceasar salad came out and it was prepared at the table. We passed on the raw egg, which I feel is a wise move after reading previous reviews alleging salmonella. Barring that, the salad was edible. 

I ordered the ribeye medium rare, and my wife ordered the porterhouse steak. Mine actually was tasty, though bloody and borderline raw. My wife's porterhouse, on the other hand, was a different story. She told me her steak tasted a bit off, similar to liver. I took a taste. To me it tasted like pee! I spit the bite into my napkin.   The waiter attempted damage control by bringing her a slab of prime rib. She didn't like it. I tasted it, and it was bland, unsalted, and I have had better at $15 buffets - time and time again. 

I really wish I didn't have to write such a scathing review, but this place is priced like an exclusive fine-dining establishment, yet prepares food like as if to act in direct defiance of the health dept. We will not be returning.

They get some things right like the steaks and the cocktails were amazing but the bread and sides were very   below par. The sides tasted like store bought.
If I ever went back i would eat the steak and salad no bread and a cocktail. 
Service was topnotch.
Atmosphere is old school but maintained.

This was my first real steak house. I yelped a couple of different spots, but kept coming back to the Golden Steer. My first impression was are you sure this is the right spot. It's in a little shopping plaza so the parking is kind of small. But once your in there, it's surprisingly very nice. It's kinda dark in there, it reminds me of what I would think old skool Vegas would be. It was a little expensive but what do you expect for a steak house in Vegas. I ordered Prime Rib diamond Jim cut that sucker was huge. It looked really intimidating when it came out. I ordered it medium-well wow it was delicious. I would really recommend this. Just keep in mind that all side dishes are not included. I ordered the twice baked potato it was OK but I thought it would of tasted better, it was a little plain. My husband ordered the bone-in Rib Eye steak, this was delicious it was nice n tender and super juicy for being well done. He also ordered the sautéed mushrooms OMG if you love mushrooms you have to order these.. They we soooo good I don't know know what else to say, they were buttery garlicky just yummy. Along with the jumbo baked potato. All I can say about that was WoW. It was huge, it came with all the goodies. All n all I recommend this place if your  carnavor like us. It's a really nice restaurant great for date night or to try something new
The atmosphere was relaxed, the chicken parm was slowly cooked perfectly. I'll be back.

Got a Groupon, couldn't find someone to eat with so came by myself and ate at the bar.  The older bartender Joe Extremely friendly along with the lady and gentleman who greeted me upon entering.  I ordered the bone in rib eye, twice baked potato, and caesar salad.  Steak was delicious, twice baked potato was slightly overcooked yet still good. Everyone raves about the table side caesar however I was bar side so I don't believe I had the same experience.  It was good but nothing amazing.  The bread comes out warm and soft with slight crisp so good.  I like the ambiance and music here.  It can certainly through you off from the outside.  My  meal was about 75-80 by myself though :-(, so prepare to shell out a little money.

They are not kidding when they say "The Best Steakhouse On Earth".

The service was incredible! I think we were helped by every service person sans the barkeep. If you made eye contact, they were at your table asking "Is there anything you want?" Not need, but want. The hostess was ready to seat us before our reservations were confirmed! 

The food was incredible. The best steak we've ever had. Truly. The wine was served perfectly. No room for dessert.

Old time vegas they deserve the respect of 5 stars. It is alittle overpriced and stuffy but they put out great steaks and prime rib.  They should remodel alittle and maybe change the uniforms alittle out dated .

The service wasn't very good. Multiple waiters kept coming to the table to get drink orders. None were particularly friendly . Then when we wanted to order couldn't get the server.  The food was just okay; nothing outstanding.

Old School Vegas Steakhouse.

AMBIENCE:  3 stars.  The bar needs to be fixed up--it is the first place you see when you walk in and it looks aged (and not in the good way),  Once you get into the steak house proper, then it is classic Rat Pack vinyl booths, with memoribilia and photos from famous people who used to frequent the steak house.  We sat at the Mario Andretti booth!

SERVICE:  4.5 stars.  We were met by a super nice hostess and seated immediately (we did have a reservation--which I highly recommend).  The server and his support staff were very good and attentive--and certainly knew the menu in and out.  

DRINKS:  3 stars.  A steak house should have perfect cocktails--ie martinis, cosmos, etc--ours were served promptly but the Golden Steer seems to use fairly pedestrian liquor in their well.

FOOD:  4.5 stars.  We started with the best Caesar Salad we had ever had--made table side by a very skilled server.  We had the Ribeye, which was good sized, cooked perfectly, and very flavorful.  We also had the Lobster Tail--which was prepared perfectly as well.  Our sides were the Twice-Baked potatoes--which were amazing and I highly recommend them--and the Creamed Spinach--which was quite good as well.  The desert was the best part--Bananas Foster made table side--the bananas were lightly coated with the carmelized alcohol, and they were amazing!  Unfortunately the ice cream it was served atop of had ice crystals which kind of took away from the overall effect.

VALUE:  This place is not inexpensive--but it is nowhere near where some of the super fancy places on or just off of the strip.  

OVERALL:  4 stars.  I think the service and food are quite good--but the bar is an issue that should be fixed.

I went to the Golden Steer for a birthday dinner and the time spent was both good and bad. The first and foremost thing is, the food is pretty good. The bad thing is, for a dinner averaging $110 per person, the food should be served hot. It's pretty bad when the food arrives cold or lukewarm and the table has to send the entire meal back. The staff was apologetic and the food came back a second time; some was hot while some was still lukewarm. 

I'll go back in the future, but it won't be coming out of my pocket.
This is probably My fav of the Steakhouses in town :) Old school swanky and the food is divine! I've never had a bad dish here, awesome history and lots of class

WOW! What an experience! Excellent food and service far above and beyond! 
Now the place is pretty pricey, but well worth it! The food was phenomenal! 
We ordered the stuffed mushrooms and shrimp cocktail. It was pretty standard and we started to worry that it was just going to be a regular steak house. Then we got the Caesar  salad made fresh at our table...AND YUMMY! It was one of the best Caesar salads I have ever had! 
And now the main course...bone in ribeye steak. Came to our table with perfect timing! The steak was cooked to order (medium well and medium rare). The steak was extremely flavorful! A distinct flavor that I would definitely come back for! The twice baked potato, fresh asparagus and mushrooms were good, but nothing exciting...but that steak...YUMMY! 
Just when we thought they had topped themselves we ordered the bananas foster...and again...WOW! Excellent presentation and the the flavor was an excellent blend of bananas, ice cream and a hint of citrus.
This place is a definite must! Come hungry, but don't come broke. It's about $270 for two people, including tip at 20%. We ordered two appetizers, Caesar salad, two ribeye steaks, twice baked potato, mushrooms, asparagus and two desserts. 
FYI We plan on going back in about a month!

The ambiance is really great, very dark & sexy & it feels like you stepped back in time. The customer service is exceptional with many people paying attention to your every need & treating you like you're special. 
Frank Sinatra tunes play in the background & the food is straight up delicious. I love seeing old school things still popular these days with all the newer restaurants. This was my third visit & won't be the last. 
If you enjoy a traditional steakhouse this one will not disappoint.

I'm a bit torn writing this review. Our meal was A-OK, but there are at least a dozen other steakhouses I enjoy quite a bit more. That said, this place is a classic. When you step through the doors you are whisked back in time. Hanging on to the past isn't a bad thing. We started with warm bread and followed with a table side Caesar for three. It was pretty average, I don't recommend it. Moving on to the steaks, I had the filet which was nicely prepared. A porterhouse and the bone in ribeye were also had along with the largest baked potato I have ever seen. Total damage was $214 before tip. Ouch... back to present day.

The steak was delicious.  We shared the 20 oz steak between two people and  was still unable to finish it.  The escargo and twice baked potato was also very good.  The food was good, but quite pricey.  The ambience was dark and decorated in old style, so it may not be the best date place.  Reservations are not needed.  I made reservations online through OpenTable, but when I got there, the restaurant was almost empty.  They didn't even record that I honored my reservation.

I returned to Las Vegas and the Golden Steer, this time for a bachelor party.  We had a party of 12 which was booked through Open Table.  We had to make a few changes with the time and the number in our party and they were very accommodating.

On arrival, they put us in a private room in the back, which was a nice surprise.  We were told that this was the room used by the "bosses" back in the day who had to come in and out through the back door.  

We had a team of servers including the Robert DeNiro impersonator that hangs around.  We started out with the the seafood appetizer which was a mix of shrimp, oysters, crab, etc.  All of which was fresh and delicious.  

This time, I went with the New York Strip which was cooked to perfection, as expected.  Out of all 12 in our group, there was not a single complaint and compliments all around.

The price tag is steep, but worth it.  Everything was great down to the food and the service.  A must do in Vegas if you are a meat connoisseur

Wonderful hosts and superlative hospitality.
One of the few stand-alone steakhouse establishments who offer the traditional accouterments of fine dining. 
Unfortunately, those efforts seem to be wasted on most of the "come as you are" patrons who are most likely more comfortable with casual style dining.

Perhaps if you check your potty-mouthed, entitlement attitude at the door and, leave the flat-billed cap in your totally sick, lifted monster truck, wear a buttoned-up, collared shirt over your wife beater and "I'm dangerous" tattoos, keep your bro-ho in check and, generally speaking, act like civilized human beings, you may find your experience here even more delightful.

Seated in the DiMaggio booth, (my personal favorite), started dinner with a Cesar Salad, best I've ever had. The table side, properly trained technique, attention to detail in the presentation and preparation with fresh ingredients is superb. 
I highly recommend the Chateaubriand for two, ordered medium rare. By the time it is sliced and plated table side, it has rested to perfection. Much better than most steakhouses serving up average $45 strip steaks. Spend the extra twenty, enjoy the show, and enjoy a proper cut of beef, served in a manner befitting an adult with refined tastes.
The twice-baked potato is delicious! 

Desert?
Cherries Jubilee. Anytime you can have someone bring a pan of something sweet, covered in Kirschwasser, Cognac, or Brandy, and flambéed at your table, DO IT!
Queen Victoria would be honored.

The Golden Steer has been and IS the best of Las Vegas.

I'm so disappointed. I really really wanted to like Golden Steer. See, I'm a food and wine writer and I choose only to write positive things in my column - which means I had nothing to write about Golden Steer. We had been planning to dine there for awhile and by chance I happened to get a Living Social certificate for $50 for Golden Steer so everything seemed perfect. From the moment we arrived, it was clear that we were not welcome and our business was neither wanted, nor needed. I would mention the name of our rude, terrible, gum chewing (I KNOW!) server, but he never bothered to give it to us. Nor did he give us a wine list until I asked for one. The server had nothing but contempt for us from the moment we presented our Living Social voucher. (If restaurants have a problem with taking these vouchers, then they shouldn't offer them, in my opinion). I guess he figured we were cheap kids and he wouldn't get a good tip. That really doesn't account for the lackluster service and presentation overall. The food was okay, not great, not bad. My filet mignon did have a piece of gristle in it - which is unaccaptable for a $45 filet, but at least it was cooked properly. The same could not be said of my Husband's ribeye. Honestly, what they did to that poor piece of meat was criminal. It was nearly burned to a crisp (ordered medium rare). Overall, the food sucks, the service sucks, and the ambiance is depressing. It's really time to turn this Golden Steer out to pasture.

I've been looking forward to coming here for a long time- brought my mother from out of town to have dinner on a weeknight, two hours before a show. The old-school Vegas vibe totally got her into the vacation spirit, and the food was pretty good, but unfortunately the service marred our evening.

Ordered the escargot appetizer ($16) - they were okay, it wasn't the best version I've had, and server did not replenish the bread so that we could enjoy the herbs and oil. Maybe we should have had the seafood-stuffed mushroom caps our server recommended.
We had the Caesar salad for the table, prepared tableside ($12/pp) - was disappointed that no anchovies were used in the preparation considering the price, but I liked the croutons. Found it odd that the salad guy did not make eye contact, speak to us, or engage with us at all? Awkward.
We waited an hour for our entrees- the Chicken of the Angels (egg battered chicken with artichokes and mushrooms), was incredible, tender and moist without being too heavy. The prime rib (rare as requested, with both fresh horseradish and horseradish cream) was decent, but the creamed spinach  was wayyy too rich.

Our server was absent for the majority of our visit, and was condescending when he was around. He asked for our order twice within 5 minutes of being seated, then copped an attitude when we asked where our food was after an hour of waiting. We let him know we had plans and he was rude about it instead of apologetic. His attitude was completely unnecessary and just made the experience even worse. After we wolfed down our entrees, he took his time coming back and getting our check- I had planned to order dessert, but he took so long that it wasn't an option. 

Then, he stood over my shoulder and pointed at the gratuity chart and stared me down as I entered his tip! Completely uncalled for, unprofessional, and disrespectful. Bringing the portable card reader to the table is a tacky move in the first place but there's a way to handle it professionally, and this wasn't it. I was so embarrassed to have picked this spot for my mom to experience a nice dinner on vacation- she commented that even the sports bar we'd gone to the night before had superior service compared to this place.

As Las Vegas locals we have been to our fair share of amazing steakhouses around town and we were looking forward to trying one of the classics, we left disappointed. The service and the food were mediocre at best. Our server was short with us and acted like he didn't really want to be bothered with doing his job.
