There were six of us in the party and we all ordered the table side Caesar salad, it was drenched in dressing and the dressing wasn't even tasty. I ordered the filet mignon medium and it was served medium well. The sides were nothing special, we had asparagus, mushrooms, whipped potatoes and creamed spinach. The others in the party seemed okay with their entree selections but nothing stood out. We had bananas foster for dessert which was the best part of an otherwise disappointing meal.  

With all of the choices in Las Vegas, this is definitely not up to par with the best steakhouses. We will not be back.

I think I must be reviewing a different dining establishment many Yelpers here are raving about!
I love nostalgia and especially the vibe of the golden age of Vegas, but that is all this place is surviving on and poorly at best. 

The steakhouse salad we were served was disgraceful. The cheapest white garbage iceberg lettuce (cmon people, not a leaf of green) inadequately drained with chunks of carrot that were actually old and dried out, 5-6 chickpeas, husband had a tomato slice, all topped in an already runny "Roquefort " dressing. Diluted Roquefort dressing my favorite.

Prime rib was not prepared to temperature. No flavor. No herb crust. I prepare prime rib multiple times a year in salt crust and it's flavorful moist and delicious. This was NOT from top grade quality prime rib! The broccoli was essentially raw. The generic French Bagette wasn't even Trader Joe's or Smiths quality. Very generic. Dining partner had lamb chops which were decently flavorful. Nothing to rave about.

Service was "ok" but water spilled on member of our party. Main course dishes left to sit for was toooo long after dining was complete.

The vibe is one of surviving on a shoestring. ...Serving a fairly low quality and mediocre flavor experience for ridiculous prices to maximize profit. The leather circular booths are nostalgic. Don't look on the ledges surrounding where they meet the wall where some giant wine and liquor bottle replicas sit. Dust is 1/4 inch thick...

Look for this to make it maybe a few more years.
Could be made really appealing. Clean it up a little, do a little overhaul and for Gods sake get a real chef in charge who didn't start his career  as a short order cook at Denny's. 

Disappointing would be an understatement.

I love this old Las Vegas landmark. I've been going there for many years. It is a steakhouse the way Las Vegas used to be. It's a couple hundred feet off the strip on Sahara. If you like a big traditional steak, this is the place for you.
    I don't think I've ever had bad service there. I've always left happy.

This place is a nice off-the-strip swanky-quaint place with dim lighting and leather seats. from the outside, during passing, one might think it looks like a run-down burlesque strip club. also, i'm guessing it's where the rat pack used to hang out and eat by all the memorabilia hung up on the wall.

food was reasonably good. american fare with the focus on steaks. we got the bone-in ribeye and new york 20oz strip. the meats were cooked perfectly and the au jus really brought out the flavor but the rib-eye was extra fatty.  additionally, i didn't find the food anymore exceptional from another steakhouse but overall it was a good experience. 

expect to pay out a lot if you want wine, salad, meats and a side.

The good part about living 30 min from the strip, is time to write your review while your dinner date drives you back home. 8:30 reservation, we arrived a little early and I had a martini while we waited for our table....not a long wait, we were seated just before 8:30. I had a little sticker shock when I realized martini was $18 (including tip.) sometimes I forget about strip prices...it was an excellent martini though, extra dirty as requested.

We ordered basic dinner salads, a side of asparagus, a side of twice baked potatoes, I got a  petite filet and my husband got the 12 oz filet. 

We received our salads promptly and noticed a few minutes later that two very loafed carts were going to the dining room beside the one we were in. Even at 8:30, the place was very busy. I was feeling pretty relaxed from my (strong) martini, and didn't even notice how long we had waited for our food to come out until Lynn stopped by to apologize for our wait, and let us know that dessert would be on the house (which was super nice, but I had been hoping for honey toast somewhere else...) 

The asparagus was perfectly cooked, the twice baked potatoes were okay, last time we had creamed spinach and I would have preferred it over the potatoes. Our steaks were glorious. I should preface this by getting a little cocky, and saying that I can grill a perfect filet mignon...I like medium rare with a gorgeous crust, and I've got it down pat. For this reason, I usually don't order filet when I am out to dinner...but theirs is *almost* as good as mine. I buy my filet at Costco for $38 for 3 steaks vs $42 for 1, so I have to take that into count... :-p 

For dessert we went with their chocolate creme brûlée that tastes exactly like my granny's homemade pudding, and the chocolate cake, which is one of the best cakes I've ever had at a steakhouse. 


We had a $60 groupon, and dessert was on the house, so our bill came out to around $72. Considering I had purchased the groupon with a local deal coupon for like $20, that wasn't bad. 

Staff is friendly and you get the fun old-Vegas ambiance, with the free entertainment of drunken bachelor parties, and middle aged men on golf trips. If you live in Las Vegas you should experience it at least once. Check for Groupons before you go.

I finally got a chance to try this place out. I gotta say I wish I would have checked it out sooner. I has the rib eye and fully loaded baked potato. The rib eye was huge and cooked to perfection. The baked potato was just alright but I ate the damn thing anyway. It's a bit pricey but well worth it. Anybody looking to do something away from the strip this is it. It's to too far off Sahara but enough. The app selection looks great. I got a chance to try the baked ravioli and it's was pretty darn tasty. Definitely give this place a shot.

I came for my birthday and loved it. I love that whole Goodfellas vibe. I felt it walking in. I felt history and class. And I loved the simplicity. The way it's supposed to be.

We were seated in the Marilyn Monroe booth which I was delighted to be in since she's my girl! Btw they have an amazing shrimp cocktail here. So fresh and beautiful. I love having my horseradish raw where I can see it.

The Ribeye was good. It was juicy. Not one of my tops, but very good. I really liked their chicken parm which is weird Bc I went in wanting meat and then I got the parm and was able to have both! Their Caesar Salad is seriously the best I've ever had. EVER. OMG. 

The service was wonderful and the staff is so accommodating and amazing. I would definitely come back!

We held a private party and the staff was unbelievably wonderful, John helped us get everything organized, Stephanie ensured our cake was delivered, Tom was the best waiter ever...and the food, just like every time we've gone was simply Devine! Can't pass this place up if you want great old fashioned service and a taste of old Vegas!

I wish I could give it a bit higher of a rating.....My food was hands down FIVE stars but the service was just meh...
We started with the table side Caesar Salad...by the way EVERYONE should make a tableside Caesar! But the person making it had NO personality....my husband even tried to joke around with him and he wouldn't crack a smile....tableside is about a show and we got no show....we barely got a hello.
Our steaks were AMAZING I had a petite filet and it was cooked perfectly as our side were great too! 
Dessert...of course we had the tableside bananas foster...again...same dry tableside waiter....and the desert was just ok...wasn't the best bananas foster I had (I suggest stop using banana liqueur as you don't need a fake banana flavor and Bacardi 151 and use a brandy.....as it doesn't burn as fast and lets the bananas caramelize more without burning...and yes we make this dessert in our house frequently)
I'd like to go back and have a different waiter...maybe I can upgrade to a 5 star review...as the food was certainly deserving of it.

I love restaurants with history, I thinks it's cool to dine some place that was a fixture so many years ago. The food is more 4 stars but I kick in the extra one based on the excellent service and history at the golden steer. We started off with table side Cesar salad, which was great ! I had the large filet and it was cooked perfect and served in an interesting au jus. The best part is its considerably cheaper then the strip options like blt cut craft etc. While there are dozens of those types of restaurants throughout the country, there is only one Golden Steer ! Make sure you visit for your piece of history.

After reading the reviews on Yelp for this steakhouse, my family and I decided to try it while visiting Vegas. It was every bit as good as the reviews rave. I am not even a huge Caesar salad fan, but the salad here is so fresh and well prepared, I loved it! 

All of our steaks were prepared exactly to our order, and my family of 4 split 4 sides, and it was hard to finish all of them.

For dessert, the creme brulee is wonderful as well as the coffee drink with 8 different liquors. It is definitely on the pricy side, but I felt we got a lot of food, and it wasn't outrageous for Vegas prices.

If you are looking for a great old steakhouse off the stop and out of the hotels this is the place. Don't let the outside scare you off. You'll get a good deal for about $75-100 you'll get prime quality beef and a few sides.  Try the caesar salad tossed table side. Awesome.

Celebrated my birthday dinner at The Golden Steer.  We made reservations in advance and requested for Frank Sinatra's booth (Table 22) as we were walked to the table the hostess told us this was the best seat in the house.  Sinatra's booth was across from Dean Martin's booth and Sammy Davis Jr's.  Our dining experience started as soon as we walked through the door, from the host stand to sitting in our booth and all throughout the meal.  

We started with cocktails: a dirty martini for me and 3 fingers of Jack with an ice cube for him.  The servers work as a team so there were several people coming around checking on us, complimenting on my boyfriends cocktail (Sinatra's drink of choice).  

Now on to the food, we ordered the cocktail shrimp appetizer, ribeye med rare with a side of sautéed mushrooms for me and NY strip med rare with a loaded baked potato for him.  While waiting for our appetizers, the dining room was filled with other diners ordering table side Caesar salads or cherries jubilee for dessert.  There was so much to watch in the small dining room of about 9 or 10 booths, whisking of Caesar Salad dressing from scratch, flambéing of cherries, birthday sparklers going off around us, and this was all before we even got our food.  Our shrimp cocktail didn't have any bells or whistles when served, but it didn't need to, the size alone was ridiculous!  The shrimp cocktail comes with 4 huge pieces of shrimp, cocktail sauce, lemon wedges and small bottle of Tabasco.  When the entrees arrived, our steaks were cooked a perfect temperature of med rare and the serving size again, made for a hungry man.  Lucky for me, I don't believe in taking a good steak home for leftovers so I did some work.  The sides were good accompaniments but the steaks were the main star.  

For dessert we decided on the Bananas Foster made table side.  You can definitely taste the ingredients added in front of you with hints of orange and nutmeg.  We ordered the Golden Steer Coffee to go with desert, the server forgot about this but as soon as we mentioned it, he immediately apologized and said, "No, you have to get it, completely my fault, it's on me"  as we were finishing up our dessert and coffee, the maitre d came by and asked us if we needed any assistance with a cab which I thought was a nice service touch.  

After 4 drinks, appetizer, 2 entrees, 2 sides and dessert, bill came out to a little over $200 not including tip, not bad for the service and food.  Definitely recommend for the experience and a great steak.

It was a long search for the perfect place to celebrate after getting married by Elvis in Vegas but when I finally found the Golden Steer, I knew for sure that I had found the one! Off the strip and standing since 1958, this Vegas institution has served Frank and the Rat Pack, Marilyn, Ali, Joe DiMaggio, Vegas mobsters and the King himself. 

We arrived dressed to the nines, him in his wedding suit and me in a white dress and fur. We were seated in a corner booth done in red tufted leather with a plaque that said "Betty Grable." Betty Grable was a World War II pinup star and actress who frequented the Golden Steer with her husband, band leader and trumpeter Harry James. Apparently they rarely spoke to each other on those visits - hopefully that doesn't jinx me and my husband lol!  

Our server was of the typical old time steakhouse variety - a bit gruff but accommodating. We ordered a nice bottle of Shiraz, Caesar salad for two, two filet mignons and some creamed spinach. The tableside preparation of the Caesar salad takes you back in time and tastes pretty darn delicious. The filet mignons were superb (though I should've taken the ladylike route and ordered the petite filet which would have been plenty filling at 8 oz, but my eyes are always hungrier than my stomach!). We were planning on ordering one of those spectacular flambé desserts but the Golden Steer had other plans for us. The waiters came over with a slice of cake lit with a sparkler singing "Happy wedding to you", which was just the sweetest (cake was delicious, too!). It was definitely the perfect way to celebrate our special day, and we would love to come back someday to celebrate our anniversary and look back on the wonderful time we had! (Hopefully we'll have a large enough party to snag the King's booth next time )

I'm shocked that there are only 3.5 stars for this place on yelp. If you've never been, don't let that deter you from trying it out. 
On Sahara, just west of Las Vegas Blvd, look for the golden cow and park in their tiny parking lot. Then walk past the red velvet ropes, and step into the vestibule where a vintage cappuccino machine greets you. Don't bother checking the year on your cell phone, it still is 2015, but not inside this joint. 
An old fashioned bar with frosted bordered mirrors and a seasoned bar tender, who's probably got more stories than a library, takes your drunk order. Pricey? You bet-cha! Worth it? Yes please! The drinks go down smooth and before you know it, your party is escorted through the restaurant by the maitre-d who happily points out the famous Marilyn Monroe booth, Elvis Presley booth, etc etc. 
Yes, every single employee in there takes pride in the restaurant as if it were their very own. I'm assuming the cooks do too because the steaks were cooked to perfection. There is a signature Caesar salad that is prepared table side, which was fun to watch, and tasted great. We skipped on dessert, but maybe next time we'll try one. Yes, there will be s next time.

like going back in time to hang out with the rat pack!  steaks are fantastic, the lobster tails are HUGE, and any place that makes your caesar salad in front of you deserves an extra star just for that alone.

can't wait to return!

What a flash back to the past!!!! And not at all in a bad way! LOVED feeling like I was dining in the 50's in this place. The food selection matched the atmosphere! Starting with the cocktails to the dessert , everything was right on!
Great food and great service. My wife had the filet and shrimp and I had the filet and lobster. Huge portions and great flavor. We'll definitely be back.

This used to be a nice place, but has gone very downhill recently
What a terrible experience last week when dining here on business trip !
Almost choked on large pieces of shell hidden within my Lobster bisque.
Waiter refused to remove cost of soup from our bill. 
Got terribly sick the next day, ended up at the hospital in serious pain
Medical tests just confirmed SALMONELLA poisoning
Just got off the phone with a top lawyer, considering legal action
Also had my doctor contact Nevada Department of Health
DINE HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK !!!

This place is straight out of the Sopranos.  The food is excellent.  It's a steak house, but they also serve Italian food.  Everything is good that I've tasted.  The stuffed mushrooms "BOMB".  The place looks like an absolute dump from the outside, but when you walk in the restaurant  is top flight.

I love this fucking place.

My buddies and I head to Sin City -- this is our spot.  Table for 8, bottles of Cab, cocktails, killer steaks, great sides . . . Old School Vegas.  Muhammad Ali celebrated his birthday here, the Rat Pack, Marilyn and Joltin Joe . . . LOVE IT!  

You wanna know what I hate about Vegas?  How they import great restaurants from other parts of the country.  I don't want to eat at Nobu in Vegas.  I want to go to Malibu for that.  I don't want to eat at Carmine's in Vegas.  I want to eat at the one on 44th St in NYC with theatre tickets in hand.  I don't want the replica, I want the gawdamn original.  And that's what Golden Steer is.  Over 50 years.  est1958.  A Vegas original.

For those complaining about the service, you've gotta understand where you are.  You don't trot your significant other or your family into Golden Steer on a Friday night and expect rush service.  If you do expect that, then go to Black Angus.  This isn't 'dinner,' it's an event.  Soak it in.  Chill for a couple hours.  Actually chew your food.  Order dessert.  Extend the evening.  Experience it.  

I've found the cooler you treat the staff, the faster and more pleasantly they serve you.  We were joking with our servers, taking pics with one server who looked like De Niro, and tipped the shit out of em.  We were there for a couple hours.  We loved it.  It was incredible.  All 8 steaks cooked perfectly.  If it's overcooked, send it back and grab another drink.  Sure beats a ruined evening while you quietly bitch about an overcooked steak and tell your fellow diner(s) how you can't wait to get on Yelp and destroy them.

Smile once in a while.  This legendary place rocks.

Bon appetit, bitches.

Had dinner here last night and it was really good!!! The ambiance was very cool, we sat at the Joe DiMaggio booth which is in between Elvis and Holly Madison. The service was impeccable and the meal was above average. My wife had a 6oz filet with crab and I had the 22oz bone in Ribeye. She said hers wasn't anything special but mine was very good and so was the twice baked potato. 

We will definitely be going back and would recommend it to anyone.

OK - a lot of people slam the Steer for having an "out-of-date" menu - but the Steer's charm doesn't come from the food. The Steer, along with Hugo's Cellar downtown, are the last of a dying breed - classic Vegas restaurants with red tuck-and-roll upholstery booths and a vintage spirit. I wish I lived closer - their lounge would be my new home.

I ordered the scallops marsala which, I hate to say, was a bit strange and totally missed the mark - but the creamed corn and steamed broccoli sides were really well done. We told them it was our anniversary when we booked our reservation, so at the end of the meal they threw in a cheesecake dessert with a flame-thrower of a sparkler on top! Festive!

The waitress was chatty and filled with cheesy Vegas tales, the old goombahs in the booth across from us kept ordering the waiter around like ex-mobster royalty and talking about how so-and-so's neighbor was a prostitute. Lots of local character and vintage Vegas wackiness.

Like I said....you don't go here for the food!

This has been our favorite Steak House in Las Vegas for years.  When we are in town, we always have made a point to eat there, and usually bring friends with us. We brag it up about the great food, the great service, and the unique "old Vegas" charm.  However, this last weekend, I experienced something different than ALL the other times I have been there. There are reviews on here that suggest that it is slowly going downhill, and I would have to strongly agree. 
We were there on a Saturday night and the place was half full. I have never seen that before. The server that waited on us seemed to be going through the motions. Completely uninspired.  The server who made the Caesar salad at the table(one of my favorite parts of the meal), was also totally uninspired and not interested at all in answering the questions our guests had about the process of making the salad. We seemed to be bothering him. We ordered a bottle of the Cakebread Cab ($140), and it came to the table warm.  At the prices they charge, and for a bottle of wine at that price point, it is pretty poor service to bring it to the table warm.  When I informed the server of the fact that it was warm, he asked me "what would you like me to do".  I didn't say it, but I thought to myself, "solve the problem!"  Instead, we asked him to chill the wine. We shouldn't have to tell the server how to handle a warm bottle of wine.  AND MORE IMPORTANTLY, why are they serving a nice bottle of wine warm?   Where are they keeping it?  Either way, not the kind of service you expect at a restaurant that charges a premium price. Outback, maybe....but not the Golden Steer.
That being said, the food was very good.  Not as good as usual, but good. No complaints about the food.
When we finished, the place was a ghost town.  No hostess around to ask to call a cab. 
No one to thank us for stopping by.  Something has changed with this place.  Employees are uninspired. They are not busy on a Saturday night.  They are not taking care of the customers like they used to. No longer would I consider this a "special" place to go, and no longer certainly worth the extra time and effort to go off the strip.

Great old-school Vegas steakhouse. Come here every time I visit. Food is good, not great, but you come here for the atmosphere and the history, if you can sit in the same booth as Elvis that's pretty cool. Service is great, need to try a table side service from the Caesar salad or a flaming desert. Waiters are very professional, dressed to the nines, funny and extremely helpful. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who goes to Las Vegas.

*****READER NOTE: I RATE BASED ON ENVIRONMENT/SETTING AND YUMMINESS OF FOOD. I NEVER CONSIDER SERVICE IN MY RATING (NO MATTER HOW BAD OR GOOD)******
Setting: 5/5
Food: 2/5

***SPECIAL NOTE: Had a Migraine and Upcoming Fever coming into this steakhouse, but my taste buds were still there, my brother and sister confirmed my judgement on their food****

Like many other reviews, this place is riding mainly only its reputation of hosting Sinatra, that's the reason I came. I absolutely adore places like this, it was away from the strip, the mood was intimate and felt classy. The decor reflected its classic history. However, the food was just not up to par. My siblings and I ordered the seafood platter, Manhattan Clam Chower, a filet mignon, and 2 prime ribs (an 18 and 24 oz). Seafood platter was quite the disappointment, clam chowder was aight, prime ribs were cooked to the correct texture, BUUTTT it was under seasoned. Ordered the 3 steak sauces, all three were quite underwhelming. Food wasn't gross that's why I didn't give it a 1, but it was overpriced for the quality of the food. 

So in short, if it weren't for Frank Sinatra and the lovely environment, this place wouldn't have people flocking to it. This place doesn't need to be the best steakhouse, but it does need major step up in the quality of their food if they wanna stick around.    

If my migraine impaired any judgement, it was giving the restaurant the benefit of the doubt, cause I was in denial of how underwhelmed I was.

This is the best old steakhouse In Vegas. You can feel the spirit of the rat pack, Robert Redford - Marlon Brando -  Naugahyde booths / the food is expensive but awesome and delectable, I love it here! Bananas foster! Fresh shrimp cocktails! Prime rib and New York steak! Asparagus w bearnaise. Caesar salad tossed table side. It's elegant! It's classy and it's old world 40s! Incredible. All our food was awesome. Creamed spinach, twice baked potato - prime rib --- so good.

I had a $50 steak that was not very good - too much gristle and not very tender or flavorful.  The clam chowder was surprisingly outstanding.  The sautéed potatoes with onions was very tasty as well.  The ambiance is old school Vegas, and the location is way off the strip.  If I'm going to pay $50 for a steak, I expect it to be excellent and the location and ambiance stellar--this place is far from that, unfortunately.  I did like the service a lot; nice waiters.

Best rib-eye steak I've had in years. Flavor was excellent. Cooked medium

Cream corn was delicious. Creamy but not to sweet.

Creamed spinach was also very good. I didn't have more than a spoon full but I will make note to get it for myself next time I'm here.

The staff are friendly and nice.

As mentioned previously, this restaurant has an old Vegas ambiance and charm. The moment I walked in, I felt as if I was a celebrity and was quickly seated and attended to by the wait staff.

Don't let the location, or outside facade keep you from coming to this restaurant. I had one of the best meals, and accommodations I can remember from any restaurant. 

This is definitely on my list of places to go when I want a great meal, ambiance, and service.

***EDIT***
Best service I ever had....period.

Let's start with the good things: escargot excellent; Caesar salad prepared table side one of the best of ever had, service excellent. Ambiance: Away from the noisy bar, excellent. 
Now to "not so good:" I ordered my steak medium rare which, in all good restaurants means a "warm red center" and it came out rare to mooing. No big deal, mistakes happen. So I sent it back and 10 minutes later they brought me the same steak that had been reheated! C'mon guys, a fine dining restaurant knows that as soon as you cut into a steak the juices escape. I would expect a steak from a casino cafe to be reheated but not a fine restaurant! The steak should have been replaced with a fresh one, not reheated and dried out! Two people, 2 steaks, 2 baked potatoes, 1 shrimp cocktail and one escargot=$300.00! Definitely NOT worth the money.

Celebrated my 50th birthday here December 7 with a party of ten.  Our experience was fabulous.  We arrived when the doors were open...we were going out that night and wanted to take our time, eat, and enjoy!  That we did!  The staff was wonderful.  Everyone really enjoyed their meal, the service, and the experience.  Can't wait for the next special occasion!  Yes, the location is not eye catching....and the decor...I'll say...vintage, but I love that old style!

This is not the same restaurant of past years.  Been eating at the Golden Steer since the early 1970's and the service and food was outstanding.  Going down hill since the 2000's.  Will not eat there any more.  Not worth the value.  Staff was very friendly and they decor has not changed.  I ordered a NY Strip steak and they butterflied it and took all the flavor out it.  We used to brag about his place to all we know who were traveling to Las Vegas, no more.
Fantastic old Vegas style steakhouse. One of Frank's favs.  Off the strip but not to be missed.

Dined at this restaurant hoping to experience some of the charm of old Las Vegas. Unfortunately we only found some good sides, pictures of past celebrities, and poor customer service.

When we first arrived and were walking up to the front door we were not greeted by a valet or door man, but by a transient who was going through the butts in the ashtray next to the front door. When checking in at the host stand I mentioned that we had a reservation, and was told to pick any table since few tables were in use. I suggested that the host check the reservation two more times, hoping that he would see the special occasion notes that were made with it, The host did not check the reservation and I was never able to covertly mention the special occasion throughout the evening.

After selecting a table our drink orders were taken by the host. A short time later a waiter came to the table who spoke with a thick accent and was somewhat difficult to understand. He seemed to indicate that our drinks probably were not being made and said he would check on them. When the drinks did arrive, the waiter commented that it was a good thing he checked because they were not being made, then asked if we were ready to order. Waiter never introduced himself or explained anything about the restaurant or menu. We placed our orders of rib eye (medium rare) and fillet mignon (medium) with a table side Caesar, side salad, creamed corn, and twice baked potato.

Salads came to table and a busser/expediter tried to remove them from he table while we were still holding forks and eating. Explained to him that we were not done yet, but would definitely set our forks down on the plate when we were. Same young man came back about four minutes later and tried to take the salads again!

The entree's were brought by someone other than the server. The cooked medium was fine, but the medium rare was over cooked. When the server was flagged down by us (never came by on his own) we advised of the issue. The server looked at the cut and excused himself to get a woman who appeared to be the manager. We explained again that the piece was over cooked, and the server interrupted the conversation with the manager to insist that we cut further into the center of the steak in hopes that the exact center of the steak might be to our liking. The manager admonished the server a little, and said obviously the steak was over cooked and had a new one ordered.

When the replacement cut arrived it was under cooked and almost slimy. My partner was frustrated as my meal was almost completed at this time, and when asked if they should fire it up again we declined because my meal was nearly completed and mentioned to them that the cooks at a "fine" steak house should be able to get their cuts cooked correctly since that is their specialty.

We left feeling quite disappointed in our attempt to visit "Old Vegas" hospitality and dining, and have told friends both in LV and going to visit to skip this steak shop.

The Golden Corral, I mean the Golden Steer has REALLY gone downhill over my past many visits. Crab cakes? Cool cold center, wait! Bone-in rib-eye medium rare? Overcooked, but the waiter wanted to argue it wasn't. After over an hour wait I didn't want to wait for the redo. Asparagus was VASTLY over-cooked. Well, they were VERY busy tonight, so I guess, next time I'll come when the place is near empty? No, there will be NO next time, thanks.

Went here 2/11/11. I got the petite fillet mignon it was very very good. 

A steakhouse should have a great steak and this place definitely did.

The sides-calamari, crab cakes, broccoli, mushrooms, onion rings, were just ok. 

The service was excellent.

Hubby got bone in rib eye.

Also, got 2 glasses of wine and a martini. 

Total bill was $175 pre tip. I think that is very reasonable dinner total.

So, the next stop on my tour of old school Vegas steakhouses brought us to the Golden Steer Steakhouse tonight. After doing a bit of research and reading a fair share of reviews, I was a cautiously optimistic about what the evening may hold.

I have to say that, for the most part, this was a fine experience and I will certainly be back!

Ordered-

- Caesar salad ($12)
- Whipped potatoes ($9)
- Rib Eye Steak, Bone-in (22 oz.) ($54)
- bread basket (complimentary)

(+) Ambiance and Decor are absolutely incredible! When setting up the reservation, I had requested the Frank Sinatra booth, if possible. Even though we were just a party of 2, they were able to accommodate my request! Usually, it is reserved for parties of 3-4 I was told. This was greatly appreciated! I was geeking out at the thought of dining in the same space where the 'Chairman of the Board' would dine as well! So. Freaking. Cool! The  bar area looked really sharp too! I can't wait to come back and enjoy some drinks here!
(+) Service was off the charts outstanding! Everyone was attentive to our needs and checked in on us to make sure everything was good! Fantastic service all around!
(+) The steaks were so tender and juicy and full of flavor! It's right up there as one of the best steaks I have ever had! (see pics)
(+) Ordered one of the Caesar salads just to see them prepare it table side. lol It was prepared much faster than I thought and tasted great!

(-) those whipped potatoes were the only part of the meal that was not superb! They were actually quite disappointing and tasted like 'instant mashed potatoes'. Ugh. Definitely will avoid that next time!

It's a matter of when, not if, I will return to the Golden Steer! The steaks are big and tasty, the service is incredible, and the old school charm and history of the place is something I can't get enough of!!

I really went back and forth between 4 or 5 stars, which is why I wish Yelp! would institute 1/2 stars into the rating system. I will likely update after some more visits...so for now it will be..

4.5 stars!

Woohoo! Pretty f*cking awesome!

the steaks here were one of the two best i have EVER had.  unfortunately everything is a la carte hence very expensive place to eat.  it looks like a dump from the outside but we can see the parking lot from our balcony and it is usually full at dinnertime.  it's an 'old vegas' haunt: dark, velvety, with dean and frank singing the whole evening. we sat in dean martin's booth (they say).  the service was very attentive when we arrived, but i think they forgot about us; not the quickest, i actually had to get up to give the waiter the check, but you can't beat the meat!
hint: they say if you sit in the bar area the food is less expensive.

Terrible service, below average food and for the price point we felt taken advantage of.  I liked the old-Vegas decor but that's about all.  For the price I expected delicious food and a friendly wait staff but we were treated like we were an inconvenience and our food was just ok.  FYI the Caesar salad is $12 a person and the dressing isn't very Ceaser-esk.  Not a fan, not going back, can not in good conscious recommend dining here.
Amazing. Fantastic food. Awesome classic decor. Old school vegas. Try the caeser salad - made at the table.

Food was good, but the experience was awesome! We had escargot, table side Caesar salad, shared a ribeye, twice baked potato, and corn. One of our servers, Alfredo, even brought out another escargot because my husband ate all of them while he and I were chatting! So thoughtful! The Caesar was very tasty and the steak was great - definitely enough to share. The twice baked potato was all I hoped it would be. The corn was on the sweet side, so keep that in mind. Gin and tonics were excellent and we finished off with a bite of the table side bananas foster (so full at this point). Tom, our other server, was fun and made the experience all the better! We will definitely be back. :)
Wonderful food but horrible service. Not sure if it's worth spending all that money to be treated so poorly.
Food wasn't that good for an expensive steak house, a step above Outback. Supposedly our waiter had been there for 40 years, he sucked!!!!! Service was terrible

the atmosphere was nice.  old italian and most of the staff was authentic italian.  the best waiter there is Fernando.,  He is attentive and has a great sense of humor.  the main problems are the food and prices.  we were two.  we ordered the 24oz prime rib.,  but it was not warm enough.  the bill for two with one glass of wine and 2 drinks was $150 a bit steep for what we got.

Great from steak to vegetable. The asparagus was tender without being over cooked mush. The Caesar salads were made in front of us from dressing to mixing. The service was great the bread was warm. Will be back again with family

You go here for two reasons: 1. You are hungry for a sniff of old school Vegas. (I am pretty sure I smelled Sinatra upon entering.) 2. You are hungry for steak. If you are hoping for anything beyond that, such as fresh mixed green salads, mind blowing sides, delicious seafood, or even a speck of modernity, I say skip it and head to one of the bajillion steak joints on the Strip. The Steer is Vegas, BABY, not the Vegas where what happens here stays here only in theory.

We went on a Saturday night, and it was dead. I was a bit concerned, but I was still grinning at the truly old school surrounds, complete with red banquettes and a live piano player. Service was relaxed; it could have been a bit more attentive in explaining the menu and getting our order in a prompt manner. (Casual is okay by the way as there were some old school locals there in their everyday getups.)  

Our order included the chopped salad, the "Ambassador of Tenderness" (12 oz Filet) and onion rings. The salad is drenched in dressing and tossed table side, so you may want to request light dressing. It is basically an iceberg salad with some chickpeas and carrot sticks, nothing spectacular. The onion rings were breaded thickly, again okay, but I am still beholden to my Atlanta Varsity rings.

The steak, however, was perfect and lived up to its Ambassador title. Enough said.

They appear to have private rooms, so round up your Rat Pack and prepare for a protein feast.

This is the second attempt to eat here (perhaps the ghost is what brought us back) im going to be super real right now... The food is comparable to sizzler or ruby tuesdays. I mean its pretty good but for what youre paying its a little ridic. This place is said to be haunted the server showed us tons of pics on there phone of orbs and weird things about closing / openings so im being super nice with the 3 stars. Youre deffintatly paying for the scenario here. Old school place with alot of history. This was the goto spot for mobbsters back in the day and a few stars have there own booth table set of ups thats always reserved for them so you might get lucky and see someone famous over paying for there food as well so you don't feel as bad

Golden Steer was overall a nice place and the steaks - food was very good.  They need to get beer on tap however.

The service needs some improvement.  Long wait for drink refills and to simply get someone to take and process our bill was a 40 minute hassle.  This would really question whether or not I return.

Went here tonight for my anniversary dinner with my boyfriend. From the outside, I was not impressed. It was definitely not like other steakhouses we have visited before. Once inside, the decor made up for the dumpy looking exterior.

We started with the fried ravioli and calamari. Both were excellent. Next up was a side caesar for me and chicken and rice soup for my boyfriend. The caesar was delicious and freshly prepared. For our main course, I ordered the chicken parmesan (not a steak fan) & my boyfriend ordered the NY strip. My chicken was excellent and a very generous size! My boyfriend was happy with his steak and said it was very delicious.

Besides our amazing food, our waiter Alfredo was excellent. He was attentive, hospitable and very aware our needs. Very satisfactory visit.

If you go to Las Vegas and don't dine here, well your just another idiot who wasted all your time on the strip. Hands down the best steak you'll have and a staff that's been around for a while so knows what the meaning of service is. 
This is upscale but not pretentious and great for any occasion. You can show up in diamond or denim and not feel out of place.

The bar is fantastic, so if there's a wait, grab a martini, and enjoy all the nostalgia from the days when Las Vegas was entertainment capital, when truly anything went, and when Deano, Sammy, and Ole Blue Eyes ruled the town.

This was the best filet mignon I've ever eaten, hands down. It was also the priciest! 

The ambience is vintage Rat Pack- red naugahyde and bad lighting. You can picture the gangsters sitting at the both next to ya. 

The only reason it didn't get 5 stars from me was that it didn't come with any sides (another $10 to dole out) and smoking is allowed in the restaurant. Yes, there's a non-smoking section, but smoke kinda goes where it wants to. Luckily the food was so good it didn't distract me as much as it normally would.

Once again the best decision I've ever made!

This will always be a staple in the timeline of my life

Spent our anniversary weekend in Vegas with another couple.  Husbands uncle is a local he says you gotta go to the Golden Steer forget about Gordon Ramseys place.  He says you get the same thing for $65 a person so we all gave it a try.  

The atmosphere reminds me of an old time piano wine bar from the 70's/80's but a little run down in need of some updating.  Waiter was weird and had an attitude that kept growing throughout the night.  He told us how hed been there quite a long time but had left for a while and come back etc making a point I guess that most of them were there for 20+ years.  

We got a bottle of wine and then ordered.  I had the filet which was nicely cooked and the twice cooked potato.  The potato was actually about the worst i have ever had because it was obvious that it had sat in the oven either all day or for hours.  It was completely burnt on the bottom but not in a good way.  You know how you can totally overdo a potato skin to complete crispy browness that its cracking apart but it still tastes good?  Ya well not like that this was BURNT.  Could not cut it with a fork burnt.  Had to use a steak knife to get through it sooo cuz our waiter was weird with attitude I wasnt going to say anything about my $10 potato.  

The waiter came back at least 5 times aggressively asking if we wanted another bottle of wine.  It started to feel like it was a demand rather than a request which we all noticed.  At the end we all got dinner drinks/coffee and dessert.  The drinks came out right away and we had a nice conversation while we waited for dessert.  The restaurant only had 3 tables and I noticed 2 waiters and a couple bussers as well as the guy doing the salads and desserts so when we finished the drinks we asked where dessert was.  We were hoping to have it with the drinks but  its like 30 minutes or more later and the waiters response was really snotty that they only had one of those dessert trays and the guy was going to get to us.  We were there at 7 pm and the only people on dessert at the time.  

We didnt understand the really negative reaction we were getting so we were doing our best to be respectful responding with yes sir etc.  Its almost as if he mistook our kindness for weakness which seems to be happening a whole lot these days when you go out.

So I watched the dessert guy make our dessert and I noticed he was making cherries jubilee instead of the bananas foster we ordered so I said something about it in a very nice way LOL that doesnt seem to matter.  The response was almost like are you effing kidding me?  This bitch makes a mistake I gotta fix?  He didnt say that but his body language sure did.  The dessert guy went away the waiter comes back with more attitude and do you want another bottle of wine again.  He seemed pissed at us that the guy was making cherries and that we didnt want that as well.  

They finally made it right and I tasted one bite and not good.  We make it better at home.  Everyone at table agreed we make it better so good thing I got the tiramisu because that was pretty good.

This is the important part.  I would never have bothered writing any of this until this part happened!  The waiter brings the bill and most of the time my husband just takes care of it but this time I had a funny feeling about the waiter so I looked at it and thank the lord I did because that dude double charged us and charged us extra for stuff that already came with etc. For instance my husband ordered asparagus with Hollandaise sauce $11.  The waiter charged us for 2 of those $22 + Hollandaise sauce $5x 2 = $10 so his asparagus was $32.

When we pointed out the errors to the waiter he seemed intensely aggravated.  He responded very quickly like he was expecting it.  I bet he was.  I bet they do that all night long.  He said oh when they put it in they must have made a mistake like someone else rang his order in and like it happens and he will have to go straighten "them" out.  Bill came back minus $150 but I am positive we still paid too much because that extra sauce crap didnt hit me til we got home that the asparagus already had Hollandaise on it and I just looked it up on the menu to be sure and yep sure enough.  

Bottom line:  These people can cook a steak but so can the Keg and Firebirds etc

DO NOT TRUST YOUR WAITER:  Go over your bill  -  They are looking for suckers

Fair restaurant prices on bottles of wine

NONE of us would ever return

Love the old school vibe of this place. As expected, they make excellent manhattans and they have a great wine list. Nothing is cheap here, but that was already expected so no surprises there. We split the ceasar salad, made at the table. My husband liked it but I didn't care for it. Even though he went mild on the anchovies, all I could taste was fish. I got a giant baked potato for dinner, which was disappointing because all the fixings were dumped into and not on the side, and the cheese kind of tasted like government cheese. My husband got the ribeye steak and wished he would have got the prime rib. We will be back and try the seafood next time (although the crab legs were $62, so not that!). The service was excellent and the old school vibe will keep us coming back.
stiff drinks, mahogany and red velvet interior and plenty of red meat.  do you need anything more? they even have booths where sinatra and the rat pack used to come and dine.

The waiter was engaging and attentive. I loved the Seafood platter for appetizer. I asked for medium or medium well for my filet but the middle looked rare. I would suggest butterfly cut if ordering the filet. It's always fun to see table side preparations. That's what he did for the cherry jubilee dessert. It was not bad. Probably just not my type of dessert.

Had a great night here. I had the filet and some seafood for an app. Everything was delicious. 

From the outside this place isn't appealing to the eye but go inside and it's very old school steak house. Loved it. Would return again!

A wonderful place to go to. Old Las Vegas restaurant but still the greatest quality and service. Wonderful service. The quality of the food is fabulous. The atmosphere is great. I can't say enough wonderful things about the place.

Very disappointed. Service was awful. Our waiter walked away in the middle of taking our drink order to make a salad at the table next to us. We had to flag him down to get our drink order completed. It only got worse from there. It took us 30 minutes to order food and our waiter would have rather been anywhere else. Our food arrived without our sides then when we asked for them it took 10 min to get them and only after asking for them again. My steak was cold by the time we got everything. Awful, awful experience.

This is a great old time restaurant.

Scot our server was impeccable and funny.  We enjoyed the table side Caesar Salad, my Filet Mignon was perfect Medium-Rare,  my husband shrimp Scampi was spot on. 

This place has been around forever,  we have been back over the years and it does not disappoint.

Oh sweet baby Jesus, I love this place. Retro decor, a waiter who does a Robert DeNiro impression, and amazing steaks. 
About mid way through my (rare) petite filet the other night-I turned to my husband and said, "I want to give this steak a baby" 
Because that's how good it is. 
There's always a point where I start to get sad that my steak will be gone shortly, so I try to slow down. But it's too hard at the Golden Steer! I don't want to slow down! Nomnomnom.

Forget the stupid fancy places in the hotels on the strip, the Golden Steer is the real deal.

Go. Now.

My dad was coming to town for his birthday and I wanted to take him somewhere Vegasy. As we were also celebrating my husband's birthday, I figured it was worth the splurge. I went in ahead of my husband and parents to give the hostess my credit card; I didn't want arguments when the bill came and she accommodated my request. The food was absolutely to die for! We got the oysters, shrimp cocktail, and fried ravioli as apps. The shrimp are huge and my husband said they were the best oysters ever. I got a bowl of clam chowder and it was seriously the best I've ever had. Everyone tried it and agreed. As for entrees: filet with crab legs (perfect) for me, a steak the size of his plate (dad), crab stuffed filet (I think) for hubs, and pasta with seafood for mom. Even though this was a highly anticipated visit with my parents from Ohio, no one spoke. The baked potatoes are big enough to share. Our table was literally overflowing with delicious food. So obviously I will go back...when I pay off this trip. I by no means think it was overpriced, but it was $500 after tip. The men each had a beer or two and my mom had a gin/tonic. The wine list looked fab and I would have indulged, but I was 7 months pregnant. The loss of a star is unfortunate- there was a group of females and older males in the back room; the "ladies" frequently walked past our table to the restroom and it definitely had a Goodfellas feel to it; which added to the atmosphere of old timey Vegas, but was unsettling nonetheless. Plus the hostess, while accommodating, was not dressed professionally. I just feel for a $500 dinner, I expect a higher standard. They have a dress code but hostess and much of clientele did not meet it.
We'll go back!!

I'm not from Las Vegas but my husband and I wanted to have a nice steak dinner for Valentine's Day. I found this place on yelp and was impressed since its one of or if not the oldest steak houses in Vegas. After dining here, I really don't understand how anyone could post a negative review. The outside entrance is very deceiving. It looks outdated and old but once you walk inside, WOW. This place is very classy and unique. Its a beautiful restaurant. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Our food was delicious. Our steaks were cooked just right and full of flavor. Yes, this is on the pricey side but it is worth every penny. My husband an I ordered their table side dessert Bananas Foster. OMG! I definitely will come back next time I'm in town. Fabulous place. Fine dining at its best!

I have never had a bad time here.  The service is just awesome.  I wish some other places I go to would send their servers here for training.  I can say that I have successfully tried all the steaks on the menu and this time I decided to try the pork chop.  My favorite place for a steak has just become my favorite place for a pork chop.

The table side service is excellent.  Salads prepped for the table, bananas foster and cherries jubilee are like a little show.  Thank you to Fernando and all the the staff there for always showing us a good time.

The place is great but more ambience than food quality. It is a traditional steakhouse with dark woods, deep red furniture, and great service. Eat where Frank Sinatra ate! Food was okay. I must say Caesar salad made table side was good. Steak was underwhelming but the place is worth the trip for sure!

I was invited to the Golden steer while in Vegas on business by a local who is friends with my boss. The build up was incredible, the food was a little meh. 

The decor is very old school vegas. You can almost feel the energy that previously occupied this space. You can picture this place on a busy Friday in the late 50's or early 60's. We were seated in a large room in the back of the restaurant that we were told was used a meeting room by mob members visiting vegas and some of the members of the rat pack. Pretty cool.

We ordered our food and were all surprised with amount of food that came out. The portions are HUGE. I ordered a filet that while huge was a little bland. The twice baked potatoes were good but tasted like they'd been frozen at some point. The desert was okay but also had a frozen taste.

if I was judging this restaurant on the food it would have been a 3 star review but the service was pretty awful. Just slow, unconcerned and borderline rude. 

Not saying I would never try this place again but for the money there is so many options that would blow this place out of the water.

The steaks are a 5 star experience. The other stuff is good but not great. We love the place except some of the waiters are a little too schmaltzy/jokey. One in particular makes some really off color jokes that are just not cool in a lot of ways & he NEVER lets up. Again, the beef here is sublime.

This place is truly amazing. Classy staff, excellent food and they play the best music!

Definitely going to be one of my "regular" places when in Las Vegas from now on!

Sorry to say, but it was a very disappointing evening.
The restaurant is very impressive, old Vegas. However the server was in a cranky mood and the food was not worth $190 bill.
I would never ever return.

The atmosphere of this place is old school nostalgia. Overall this was an excellent place for a special dinner.  The apps were excellent and the table side Caesar salad was the best I've ever had.  The steaks were cooked to perfection, but might have stood for just a bit more seasoning.  The lobster tail was very large and good, but a little chewy.  And cherries jubilee, are you kidding me?  Outstanding, you can never find that any more.  The service was outstanding, and thanks to the management who comped my son's meal before his deployment overseas.  Top notch!

I have driven by this restaurant hundreds, probably thousands, of times while growing up here in Vegas, and I had never tried out out until yesterday evening. I wish I had tried this place out earlier, as it proved to be some of the most excellent steak I have had in Vegas.

The real reason I held off on trying this place out for so long was the cost. It is an expensive restaurant, which each steak priced at least $35 and the Italian Specialties (Chicken Parmigiana, etc) running at about $26-$27. That being said, I did use a Groupon to eat here. The Groupon was good for $50, enough to really only cover one person.

The interior of the restaurant stands in stark contrast to the crappy strip mall that it resides in. It's dark, as classic Vegas restaurants tend to be, and has a wonderful atmosphere. It's definently obvious the place was built in 1958, and the history of the building is easy to see and feel.

The waiters couldn't have been nicer. They greeted me as though I were a regular in the place, and popped over my table from time to time to share stories about the more famous patrons (The Rat Pack, Elvis Presley, Mario Andretti) of the restaurant. Apparently, Robert De Niro's son also works here as a waiter, which doesn't make much sense...but hey, that's cool.

As an appetizer, I ordered the signature garlic bread ($5), which was pretty tasty. It's pretty much impossible not to make a huge mess when eating it, which makes it all the more fun. The regular bread was excellent as well, and came out so fresh and hot that I almost burned myself when I grabbed it. No complaints though, I'll take hot, fresh bread any day of the week :)

For the entree, I had the 14 oz. Top Sirloin steak ($37) and a side order of steak fries ($8). I am a seasoning and sauce fanatic...but this steak needed nothing extra. Much like Bob Taylor's Ranch House, the meat is cooked in such a way that the natural flavor of the meat is rich enough that no extra seasoning is necessary. 

When all was said and done, my bill came out exactly to $50, so I just had to throw the waiters a tip. It was truly an excellent meal, and I would consider this in the upper echelon of Vegas steakhouses.

We've been wanting to go to the Golden Steer for so long due to the history and what we had heard about the food.  The ambiance is awesome, even though they pack people into the same corner until it's completely full when the other side of the room is empty.  Don't understand that concept, but server Mike was great, along with his crew.  He was on top of our needs throughout the evening.  There was a 3 combo appetizer special, both in hot and cold versions.  We got the hot version with calamari, ravioli and stuffed mushroom.  We had forgotten about all the bad reviews on the mushrooms.  Needless to say, the other reviews are accurate.  The mushrooms were awful and cold.  In fact, none of the appetizer plates were real hot.  The calamari and ravioli are mediocre at best and the ravioli is breaded a fried (didn't expect that and it was not good).  The term I used throughout the evening was "ordinary".  We also ordered the Caesar Salad, sans anchovy paste, and it was cool having it made at your table.  Taste was what you would expect, but for the price, I would have at least expected the large pieces of cheese you get on nice salads and perhaps homemade croutons...instead we had shaker cheese and croutons out of a bag.  Nothing to write home about with the salad.  For dinner, my husband ordered the Veal Parmigiana.  After the first bite, I could tell it was awful...he was not impressed and was real disappointed since we expected to have a really good dinner.  I ordered the bone-in ribeye, as it's a specialty there....and it was very good and cooked to a perfect medium-rare.  They can do steaks just fine.  For the sides, we ordered the mashed potatoes and broccoli.  The broccoli was barely cooked, so very crunchy and had absolutely nothing on it; no olive oil, butter...nothing.  Couldn't eat it so packed it to take home and steam myself with some olive oil.  The mashed potatoes were ok, but nothing stellar.  I could eat those, but took most of it home.  Finally, for dessert, I ordered bananas foster for one.  It's cool they make it table side with the fire show and it was really good.  Glad there was a good dessert after a mostly disappointing meal.  Tab was around $225...and definitely not worth it.  We won't have dinner there again, but are glad we went and now finally know!  Way too much $$ for mediocre (at best) food.

We usually take my dad to Del Frisco's when he's in town, and he loves that place. However, this time, we decided to also try the Golden Steer. I'd been there before and like the ambiance (even though it's a bit worn), but I don't like being cheated, so I won't be back. Read on if interested.

We arrived early and had a drink at the bar. I ordered a very standard Cosmo, which the very grouchy bartender, who barely acknowledged us, is apparently unable to make. I asked him what he had put in it that made it so sweet, and he responded that he'd put in... pineapple juice! It was quite yucky and it was obvious that I was not happy, yet he made no attempt to make me happy. My dad doesn't like the fuss, so we paid for the drinks and took them into the dining room when the table was ready.

The nice waiter asked me if everything was ok with my drink, and I said I hated it. He was fantastic and immediately offered to give me a real Cosmo (for free, of course). He went and fetched it from the bar and I was definitely pleased with that. The food was decent, but not outstanding. However, when the  bill came, I saw that I was charged for a Cosmo -- what a job! I'd paid for the first one at the bar and the second one was supposed to be comped. Turns out the hostess and the waiter thought I'd ordered the first one from the waiter and thus charged me for it. How is that possible? They saw me walk into the dining room with the drink and he was the one who asked me if I had enjoyed it, and since he hadn't taken the order, it was clear that the drink must have come from the bar. I was quite flabbergasted by this and told the waiter to take the drink off the bill. He said it would take 15 minutes to do this, as they were so busy. What? THat's insane. As an alternative, he offered another drink instead. I didn't want another drink. as I had to drive, but they made it very clear to me that it was terribly inconvenient for them to remove this drink -- which was their mistake in the first place. The whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth and I will most certainly not recommend this place to tourist friends. I don't want them to get bad drinks and then get cheated!

Met friends from out of state that we wanted to please. Had eaten here before and were delighted. Can not say the same about tonight. Met at the bar brought to our table, forgot to give menus which was not so terrible. Took another 30 minutes if not more before a waiter decided to come over. My glass of water was not replenished once throughout the meal. The waiter put on his best de Niro game face and tried to make light of the situation. But when diners are spending the kind of money we spent or would have spent more the service should have been top notch instead we were treated like this was steak and ale. Will not be back.

Loved it but not 5 stars love. Wonderful server (Umberto I believe) Nice place with old school charm. A few things that would make me happy would be:
Serve the martini with an extra shot on the side in an ice bucket. Improve the bread choices.
Loved the broiled crap legs and the prime rib was very good.
